description:
This is a cute pizzeria with fast service and great food. I tried a few different slices of pizza and especially liked the Bianca - cheese pesto slice. 

Will definitely come back to try different slices!
author: Senaa A.

description:
A neighborhood pizza parlor on Divisadero serving mediocre pizza.

I work in the neighborhood and passed by this place while looking for new, good lunch spots. The first time I passed by this place it was packed with high school students and others. That made Presidio Pizza seem like a very lively spot. I was going to lunch somewhere else but decided to come back the following day. Part of the appeal to me was the "Fillmore vibe" of the restaurant's interior design, and its wood-glass-contemporary layout. 

I was not so impressed when I came back the next day. The place was emptier, and the pizza was not very flavorful. I ordered two slices - their names which escape me because it wasn't too memorable. Pizza was warmer than lukewarm, but not as hot as I would like. Nothing was strikingly wrong with this place - it was just an overall underwhelming experience. 2/5.
author: Chris W.

description:
I was craving pizza. I adore variety so I always look out for spots that deliver pizza by the slice. While browsing DoorDash, I found Presidio Pizza Company. I placed our dinner delivery order on Sunday, April 15th at 6:40pm. It arrived at 7:22pm. We live in Outer Richmond.

*Buffalo Chicken Wings, Celery, Carrots & Blue Cheese ($10)
*Frankie's (Single Slice): Sausage, garlic, cherry peppers, onions ($4.25)
*Bianca (Single Slice): Ricotta, mozzarella, garlic, pesto (4.25)
*Widow Maker (Whole): Salami, sausage, pepperoni, meatball ($31), add Mushrooms (+$3)

The roommate is a simple pizza guy. He loves the standard meat and veggie pizza. I guess there were only two pizzas with a variety of meats that weren't chicken, so I picked the the widow maker. Added mushrooms cuz I love them so. I like a good new york style pizza as I prefer a thinner crust, so this pizza was up my alley. Good amount of toppings and the crust retained a nice chew. For the slices, I decided to try Frankie's (as I read a lot of good reviews about it) and the Bianca (cuz I love a good slice of pesto pizza). The bianca was a good contrast to all the meat. I actually preferred the widow maker over frankie's as I'm a pepperoni lover. But I did enjoy the peppers on the frankie's slice. I actually added jalapenos to the window maker as I like a little heat. The buffalo wings were standard. Not much heat though. I did adore the blue cheese dip. Had real chucks of blue cheese which I appreciated. I was bummed they didn't come with the carrots and celery as I adore my veggies. I know some think of it as garnish, but I feel like half my app is missing when the veggies aren't there.

Good pizza. I'm glad I found this place. And delivery was only $0.99 on DoorDash. I was just bummed I didn't get my vegetables. I didn't complain as I didn't realize it until later, but giving them three stars because of that. Otherwise, I would have given them four.
author: Elena N.

description: First time at this Pizza Parlor. My LO went to preschool at Dr William L Cobb Elementary. We always passed by, but never tried. The employees are all very friendly. They gave the kids at the school a coupon to get a slice of free pizza. Clean establishment. Very nice ambiance, very relaxing. I will recommend this Pizza Parlor to friends and family. Can't wait to come back again.
author: Tina L.

description: My favorite pizza place in the neighborhood! Lovely service. Reasonable pricing and amazin taste ! They do delivery as well!
author: Ivan D.

description: Excellent vegetarian options. Great beer selection. Super kid friendly. Service is excellent. Love love love the PPC
author: Mandy W.

description: Pizza is bad, it's just in my neighborhood and convenient. If dominoes was closer I'd go there
author: John A.

description: Probably my favorite place to eat in San Francisco ! Great service and options! Would really recommend trying the Widowmaker absolutely amazing! They do have other options such as pasta and salads! Can't forget the wings! Buffalo chicken wings were delicious!(:
author: Sam K.

description: BAD ass pizza place nice friendly man and a paisano cooking the best pizza I had since shakys was here in San Jose
author: Joe L.

description:
Presidio Pizza company offers various kinds of pizza that all taste amazing! The times I've been there, I'm always extremely satisfied with the quality and taste of my pizza slices. I recommend trying out one of each kind of pizza for anyone who's new to the restaurant or are just hungry for delicious pizza. My favorite part about Presidio Pizza company is how late they're open till. It's wonderful for those who go to concerts and raves which end near midnight or even later, and having pizza, not only for some wonderful hangover food, but also something great and relatively cheap to eat.

I highly recommend trying out Presidio Pizza Company!
author: James V.

description:
Disappointing.  I'm wondering if the quality of the pizza has changed due to a change in ownership.

We walked in to see a sulken looking counter clerk with a white shirt. He barely acknowledged us as we waited patiently in the front. After a few minutes, he asked what we wanted but seemed curt with our questions and remained sullen despite our thank yous when he served us.  

The pizza itself wasn't good. The crust has a semi hard cardboard texture with no taste, the pizza sauce is sweet, and the toppings seem poor quality (pepperoni has no taste). The parmesan cheese is bright yellow, and looks straight out of a low end grocery store. I would go to north beach and go to places like Il Cesaro as well as baonecci if you want good pizza.
author: Michele Y.

description:
If you need a quickie, get a Frankie in your mouth!

PIZZA ... for goshsakes. 

Presidio Pizza Company boasts NY style thin crust pizza with just the right amount of tangy tomato sauce and fun California-ish toppings on your pie. I love the Frankie and have gotten this on several occasions; comprising of sausage, rapini, garlic, onions, cherry peppers and Grande Mozzarella. Ingredients are fresh, despite looking like it has been sitting behind that glass case. They heat it up for you so it's always hot off the oven! I tried the Anthony as well: pineapple, ham, serrano peppers, grande Mozzarella and romano cheese. I'm not too crazy about this one, since I prefer the classic ham and pineapple combo. 

It's conveniently located near core40 so I can come here after and grab a quick bite after torching some calories. If you stick with the Frankie, you're putting in a healthy dinner in your tummy without going overboard, unlike other traditional pizzas. These guys are quick! I'm in and out in 5 minutes.

Pair that with polite service and affordably priced slices at only $4.25 , this will be the best (and cheapest!) quickie ever! :-)
author: Janice C.

description:
This is a great spot to eat at for lunch (the only time I've been). The pizza is cheap and extremely tasty. My favorite is the Frankie slice, but all of them taste great. Big slice for $5 (including tip) is not bad for eating in the City. (After commuting from Pleasanton, and forgetting to bring my own food, I need a cheap meal for lunch). One slice is big enough to fill me up until dinner, but I have a small appetite so maybe 2 slices is better for someone with a "normal" appetite. The best time to go is around 12:30pm/1:00pm... there are never too many people there around those times. Also, the staff are very nice and willing to accommodate special requests (I got arugula added on top of my slices for no extra charge). 
The pizza (by the slice) tastes great, the price is reasonable, the venue is clean and bright, and the staff are respectful and exceptionally nice.
author: Van C.

description:
Some of the better pizza I've had in the Pac Heights neighborhood. I think Pizzeria Delfina has better pizza but its a totally different style of 'za and different ambience. Presidio Pizza is a good place for a casual dinner or lunch, and it is normal regular crust pizza... no fancy smoked salmon or arugula as toppings. The restaurant is small inside so I don't think a group of more than 5 would fit comfortably. 

I appreciate that you can walk in and get a slice and glass of wine. I will definitely be back.
author: Chelsea J.

description: Love this place but after leaving sf for half a year I was excited about coming home and getting a slice from here my favorite is the pesto w ricotta I believe it's called the Bianca but needless to say I was sooooo beyond disappointed. I've gone here so many times in the past and it's never failed but this week they didn't have the slice I wanted so I opted for something different. The two slices I choose where obviously old once I bit into it I was pissed it was tough and the toppings where dried out the guy behind the counter seemed annoyed and unenthusiastic he told me one of the slice I choose had certain toppings but he was off and I don't even think he knew he just told me what ever. At first I wasn't even gonna buy a slice considering they didn't have what I wanted but I did anyways for my love of this place it's definitely lost its touch and I hope they can pull it together
author: Anjelica H.

description: Pretty good pizza...a little pricey, but overall very good. The space is a little small, so better for ordering takeout than sitting in if you're with a big group!
author: Nicole T.

description: Picked up two slices of pizza to go and was hoping to relax and watch something and enjoy it after long day. But as I was chewing I bit into a piece of plastic. It ruined my evening. First due to feeling disgusted and second because my tooth has been hurting since. I called them and they asked me to send pics. Didn't receive any response back so I showed up next day at their shop to get my money back. They offered me free pizza but I really didn't want to eat there anymore after this experience. I didn't really like the pizza much either. Was very disappointed as reviews were so good.
author: Nupur J.

description:
Nice service and comfortable atmosphere. You can order your pizza to go or sit at a table for service. They sell slices for about $4 each which is convenient. 

The slices are large and served hot. I tried the Bianca which was white pizza with plenty of cheese and pesto on top as well as the Widow Maker which had slices of pepperoni and sausage. I preferred the Bianca but both were good and satisfy any pizza craving.
author: Linda X.

description:
My friend got a slice of pepperoni pizza (about $5) and he said it was pretty good.

It seemed pretty empty around 3:30 PM when I went. Not sure why this place has 3.5 stars because the pizzas looked pretty good.
author: Esther Y.

description: I live in the area so, I decided to try Presidio Pizza the staff was very welcoming the pizza was very delicious I would recommend anybody hungry for good pizza.
author: Reem N.

description:
:(

This place used to be good.... They used to have garlic knots decent pizza and decent chicken parm subs. Welllllllllllllll they must be cutting costs. 

My chicken parm sub was no longer any type of chicken cutlet. Instead it was a cheap frozen safeway or costco chicken "patty" with the ground cheap chicken meat. No longer was the sandwich adorned with quality mozzarella. They also changed the bread to something that dosent resemble the original higher quality sandwich bread. 

Their garlic knots used to be delicious, now they're off the menu. 

The pizza has less char on it now and seems more doughy. Maybe turning the oven down trying to save costs. But the pizza is the only thing I had from my dinner that remained tasty. 

I'm assuming the place must be struggling otherwise these cost cutting measures would not have been done. For one year I had a very decent pizza place down the street from me, it appears those days are over. Cost cutting has cost Presidio Pizza Co a customer. 

Luckily, Tony's Slice House opened near. Its delicious and consistent with more friendly staff. I've been surprised at how grumpy several counter persons can be at Presidio Pizza Co when I'm just trying to get a slice. It has honestly kept me from visiting as often.
author: Peter M.

description: I love this place . Super kid friendly and the service is great. My Favorite is the Pepperoni Calzone. I like bringing my daughter here.
author: Melissa G.

description:
This place is fine. You won't be blown away but you won't be mad at yourself either. It's pizza, you'll eat it. 

The meatball sandwich is pretty weak though.
author: John B.

description: Great spot for a quick bite to eat! I ordered the Divis & Pie even though I'm not usually a fan of pesto. This  slice had just enough pesto to give it that flavor without overpowering it. I didn't eat in, but the restaurant looked pretty nice. Prices per slice vary, but are all around $4. They accept card and parking is street parking.
author: Rachel A.

description: AMAZING PIZZA, great service the Inside is beautiful and overall just amazing definitely one of my favorites would recommend to everyone looking for good pizza
author: S A R A.

description:
We came here for a quick bite last week.
I must say, the reason why I'm giving it 3 stars is because everyone was nice.

The pizza itself was not good at all, the pizza dough tasted old and bland. On the flip side, this place is open until 3 am so of you're looking for a bite late at night I'm sure this will do.

As for me, I will probably not come back.
author: Josh Giosue D.

description: I was recently told I was "too extreme at my ratings and no one would take them seriously"....might I remind you yelp is for expressing MY OWN REVIEW and experience of a place!!!! Silly old geese! So here's my OWN opinion and experience about this place. I was greeted at the door very friendly young ladies working here. I asked for a white pizza with basil and ricotta OH MAH GAWD...BOMB! I ended up ordering 2 more which I thought I'd take home....NOPE, ate em here! My son liked his slice of pizza as well, nice thin crust and flavors don't overpower at all. Well balance! Would def come back!!
author: Ellie O.

description:
Something has gone horribly wrong at Presidio Pizza.  Also, before I get going on a rant, I tried to find an e-mail address to give them feedback directly, but no such luck.  And I'm not about to call them and tell them that they ought to do better.

I order their pizza about once a month, and last week, my gluten-free pizza was delivered par-baked.  It was as if it was microwaved.  So so so so gross.

They've also removed the more interesting components from their signature combinations, such as omitting the spicy peppers from the "Frankie," etc.  

Lastly, the buffalo wings were soggy.  

I'll probably try them one more time, and if I get a microwaved pizza, I'll just lose it and call them, pronto.  Sigh...
author: Valerie T.

description: Amazing pizza!!!! My daughter has a gluten allergy and she said there gluten free crust pizza is the best she's had!!!
author: Kelly B.

description:
Got a slice of Morgan today for lunch - $5 with tax. Reheated nicely. Tasted great - light airy crust. Reminds me of NY pizza - I'll be back as I just work around the corner. Want to try the Bianco next...
I got great service and it was quick too. Check it out - it's local, people were nice, pizza was good.
author: Christine V.

description:
Crust too thick and doughy, not crispy. Sub par pepperoni: no flavor and tiny. Nice interior and staff, but management could definitely tweak their pies. Disappointing.

Positives: fair pricing.

Why can't SF do slices right? :(
author: Moids M.

description:
Get pizza, not pregnant. 
#RelationshipGoals

I was about 300% hungrier than any person who's ever lived and that may have influenced how I felt/feel about Presidio Pizza Company, but the fact that my bill for two massive slices of pizza (both for me because there's no 'we' in pizza) was $4 didn't hurt either. 

Inside is chill. You can order at the counter and take your ish to go, or sit down and get a server. You can get whole pizzas, giant slices, calzones, beer & wine, etc... all for what seemed like a pretty nominal price tag in pretty hip setting that's surprisingly not sticky given the general reputation of by-the-slice type joints. 

They had a number of veggie slice options ready to go and none were dry like you kind of half expect when stuff is sitting under glass for who knows how long. I'd assume they keep a pretty watchful eye on the freshness factor given my superb experience. I know plain cheese sounds boring, but theirs is the stuff my dreams are made of. A perfect base pie, no doubt. I also got a margherita pizza made with heaping heirloom tomatoes that was equally as heavenly and on deck for my next visit is the Mediterranean that was loaded with olives, one of my top 10 salty food snacks. 

I don't exactly know why my two slices were so cheap, but at the time my receipt only had $1 listed as the price for the cheese. I think it might have been a happy hour special or something but I didn't ask because I'm not going to argue with a giant $1 slice. Homegirl ain't that cray.
author: Candice G.

description: Just walked by and smelt the food. I ordered a Caesar kale salad and it was amazing! Staff is attentive.
author: Jason And Lili J.

description:
I was completely ignored for 10 mins while picking up my order. The guy, named Rye, was standing in front of me and would not acknowledge me. When I asked to be helped he said he would not help me. 

I then had to walk around the counter to find someone to help me. When I said that was rude to ignore me and make customers wait, they said that was my problem not theirs. Their pizza is not good enough to be treated this way.
author: Luci B.

description:
Soon after moving to the Lower Pac Heights area, I decided to pop into Presidio Pizza Company. Despite having pizza the night before in North Beach, I decided I could totally do back-to-back nights of sauce and cheese-loaded carbs!

I started off with a cider while watching some NFL. The staff were very upbeat, attentive, and took great care of me from start to finish. After reviewing the menu (pizza, pasta, calzones, and dessert), I settled on a pepperoni calzone. Nothing like ricotta, mozzarella, and pepperonis baked in a golden crust and dipped in marinara! The meal was delicious, came out in a reasonable amount of time, and I would definitely recommend to someone looking for pizza in this area.

You have to rock my world with pasta or pizza to earn 5 stars, so I'm gonna give this place 4 stars for a valiant effort. :-)

UPDATE:

Revisited this place multiple times over the past few weeks and it seems they have new management or have turned over several key staff members from before. They've been less friendly, don't answer the phones, and have had less and less slices late at night. If you're a pizza place and your hours say you're open until 10pm, answer the damn phones and make pizza up until 10pm! 

They clearly had slices in the window when I walked in tonight bur couldn't take the time to warm them up and charge me--I was told I could wait 20 mins to go to the bar next door where they give their extra cold slices.

This place is going downhill in a hurry, which sucks, Bc they used to be my favorite place on the block!
author: Garrett F.

description:
Late night pizza - 4 stars
Minus two for the mice my friends have seen. 
No points taken off for some pretty bad buffalo wings.
author: Josephine L.

description: The service was good. The pizza had that homemade quality. So glad we decided to stop in!
author: Faith L.

description: Danilo and John are the best. Come here for late night pizza and you will not regret it. Coolest dudes around. Pizza was solid too, hit the spot!
author: Ken C.

description:
Top notch service! The waiter here was extremely friendly and attentive to our table of 7. We got really good pizza and salad recommendations and prompt water refills. I forgot his name, but he's super funny. We had him take a picture of our party of 7, which we should have checked the picture before we exited the restaurant. Why? Well we were all taking a look at the picture he took and were like "why are there only 6 people in this photo?". Umm awkward.. . our waiter inadvertently left someone out of the photo. What's worse is that there was so much empty space on the top half of the photo that all he had to do was tilt the phone slightly downwards and it would have been a much better shot. 

7 people sharing 2 whole pizzas was more than enough. We still had enough leftovers for 2 people. Here are the flavors we got

Frankies (Sausage, rapini, garlic, onions, cherry peppers, grande mozzarella) - This is really similar to combination pizza. This is a standard/classic to get here, though it's not something that really stands out or is super exciting. 

The Anthony (Pineapple, Ham, Serrano Peppers, grande mozzarella, romano cheese) - This is your Hawaiian pizza equivalent. They were very generous with the pineapples though the pineapple distribution was not that even throughout the pizza. Could have taken a little more care with spreading out the pineapples. 

Divis&Pie (grilled chicken, pesto, cherry tomato, artichoke, mozzarella) - This was my favorite of the 4. The artichokes brought out great balance and flavors to the pizza as a whole. 

Bianca (ricotta, grana padano, mozzarella, garlic, oregano, pesto) - This one was very cheesy. A lot of solid ricotta cheese chunks over the pizza. If you want something on the cheesy side without that much of 'actual toppings', this is for you.

They also have this type of hot vinaigrette sauce to serve with the pizzas. It's slightly spicy but not too bad. 

$10 each (including tip and tax) for a party of 7, though if you count our leftovers, we could have had 9 people and still be full. Very affordable lunch for SF!
author: Jonathan T.

description:
Best pizza in SF. Forget little star.  

Small corner shop feel, not over crowded or over bearing. 

Meatballs on marinara are the best I've had anywhere. Ny La or Italy. Better than my mothers meatballs.  Whoa!
author: Armen M.

description:
Pretty weak spot. Used to come here religiously 2 years ago, but every time I've come back since I've been disappointed. New staff. Worse quality food. Higher prices. Whole staff seems perpetually high, I haven't had a good slice from here in too long to remember, and selections gone down. Also got rid of calzones to focus on the pizza?.. but don't think they ever did that. 

TL;DR: don't come here unless you're back in 2015 somehow.
author: PJ F.

description:
No thanks. 

Ordered some meatballs and a pizza. 

After waiting an hour and a half the delivery guy he shows up some meatballs. I ask where is the pizza, he looks back at me with confusion. What the pizza? He looks at the receipt and figures out he should have also brought a pizza. So he goes back to bring me a pizza. The pizza was still hot so when he came the second time so I put it all behind me. 

I put it all behind me until I sampled the product. I'm not a big fan of burned stuff on the bottom of my pizza. The pizza was not burnt, it was something stuck to the bottom of the pizza, probably burned toppings from the oven. It took away from the flavor. A flavor that wasn't all that bad, certainly not my favorite. The sauce is a bit zesty and the pizza is cooked well,  it's just very ordinary. 

I'm sure they won't miss me coming back. Somehow I also feel like it should have cost a bit less than the delivery guy told me. I'm not sure? I paid cash after reading that more than a few others had been overcharged, fat fingered on a tip rerun. I wonder if they just think no one will notice being over charged,  cheated and stolen from? 

Not even glad I tried it, not ever going back.
author: Ben M.

description: This place has solid pizza. And the staff during the daytime is also pretty solid. But god damn do they have some morons who work here in the evenings. They simply don't get a shit. They fuck around and don't pay attention. They openly complain about stuff in front of the customers and actively ignore people coming in. If I was the owner I'd keep doing my thing but fire the morons who work evenings. Act like you give a damn.
author: Jesse A.

description: Great atmosphere, definitely very pleasant space, very welcoming staff, kids friendly, great happy hour specials. Ingredients taste fresh and pizza is well balanced. They could have a better selection for wine and beer though. Other than that, this is one of the best in the neighborhood.
author: André F.

description:
Came here last night after reading all the positive reviews with its claim of New York style pizza.. Here's my pro's and con's:

Pro's:
The service was good and our waitress was very nice.
Prices were normal for a single slice at $3-3.50

Con's
All the claims to being New York style is a total lie, unless there's a new type of New York style pizza that's like round table.  Now don't get me wrong, I'm not saying it was horrible, I was just let down on the fact that its not truly New York style.  The only type that was "somewhat" (and I use somewhat very loosely) similar to ny style was the cheese pizza.  For the record and to give context I've been to New York and have had a lot of pizza there.  The difference is true NY style has thin (not burnt or crispy) crust, which is flexible allowing you to fold the pizza, with ample cheese, and usually a zesty sauce.

Overall, I wasn't impressed and so far the only true places to serve to NY style in the Bay Area is Speederia Pizzeria in San Carlos and A Slice of New York in Sunnyvale/SJ.
author: Mike M.

description:
While SF may not have the same reputation as the likes of Chicago and New York, I'd say the city has its fair share of quality pizza joints.  Tony's Pizza Napoletana, Pizzetta 211, Zero Zero, Little Star, Beretta...all are awesome spots.  However, I have to admit that before Presidio Pizza Company, I didn't have a go-to spot for a tasty, NY-style slice!

As soon as I walked in, I just about fell in love.  The place has a cozy, neighborhood vibe, a highly personable staff, and a giant pizza paddle on their wall that I kind of wish hung on mine (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/presidio-pizza-company-san-francisco#YuRHMOBqcHMgrSirbAn8YA).  Plus, even though they're modest in size, PPC has enough tables to seat parties large or small (there's also a standing counter section for those just grabbing a slice).  Oh, and did I mention they have a menu full of delicious appetizers, pizzas, sandwiches, salads, and calzones?

**NOTE: the crusts have been pretty consistent every time - thin and slightly chewy yet thick enough to not get soggy.  Also, the prices listed are for whole pies, not what we paid.

-- CHOPPED ROMAINE SALAD with Bacon, Provolone, Hardboiled Eggs, Cherry Tomatoes, and Avocado Vinaigrette...$12
(http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/presidio-pizza-company-san-francisco#JE1aOupgsX6Nvyex5gHydg)
So good!  It might seem pricey for a starter salad, but the portion size isn't that of a starter.  I wouldn't have guessed that the vinaigrette was avocado (it was orange-ish), but it was tasty.  Of course, all that bacon and provolone didn't hurt either!

-- HERBED GARLIC KNOTS (5 Pieces)...$5
(http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/presidio-pizza-company-san-francisco#JDae19psxy9OVOJLkyuq3A)
Kind of a twist (knot, if you will...) on garlic bread sticks.  The center was a little chewy/bready, but the garlic level was spot on.  The flavor wasn't overly harsh or intense, but it was more than just "garlic" for posterity's sake.

-- PEPPERONI...$20
-- BIANCA - Ricotta, Grana Padano, Calabro Mozzarella, Garlic, Fresh Oregano, Pesto...$22
(http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/presidio-pizza-company-san-francisco#Dab5znepBSwEj7RY38UXfQ)
The flavor was standard, but they sure piled on the pepperonis!  As for the Bianca, it was great!  I favor pestos and white pizzas over red sauces, so this was right up my alley.  The ricotta made it a little heavy, but I liked the creaminess it added.

-- WIDOWMAKER - Salami, Italian Sausage, Pepperoni, Meatball, Grane Mozzarella...$26
-- DIVIS & PIE - Grilled Chicken, Pesto, Cherry Tomato, Artichoke, Fiore de Latte Mozzarella...$22
(http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/presidio-pizza-company-san-francisco#UxysoVSBGyk9wcw-S00i4w)
As the name suggests, the Widowmaker isn't their healthiest option, but it sure is tasty.  Of the bunch, the meatballs were the best - hefty and very flavorful.  The Divis & Pie, on the other hand, had a comparatively light mix of flavors that I liked.  However, there might have been a little too much of the artichokes and tomatoes.

-- FRANKIE'S - Sausage, Rapini, Garlic, Onions, Cherry Peppers, Grande Mozzarella...$22
-- MORGAN - Mushroom, Onion, Bell Pepper, Eggplant, Cherry Tomato, Grande Mozzarella...$22
(http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/presidio-pizza-company-san-francisco#lT0dTEUJopQhv3W2Ss-lcQ)
For me, of the ones I tried, the Frankie's might have had the best balance of flavors.  It's a little savory (sausage), a little sweet (onions), and a little bitter (rapini)...yum!  The Morgan, however, is my least favorite.  It didn't taste bad, and I don't have a problem with veggie pizzas, but the flavors weren't super unique.

To top it all off, it's awesome that PPC is open until 2:30am on Friday and Saturday nights.  Super handy for when those late night hunger pangs hit.  If not for the Morgan and, to a lesser degree, the Divis & Pie, I just might have rounded up from FOUR AND A HALF STARS.  Not that it would take all that much for me to bump them up down the line...
author: Mike L.

description: I Love the Pizza, but they forgot my beverages and paid 2 dollars for "half" mushroom that covered 2 pieces.
author: Jeremy S.

description:
This is one of my favorite pizza places in SF. You get great pizza and service. They even serve beer! The pizzas are always spot on. $22 for a large and you can split it between 2 different flavors if you can't decide. They also sell pizza by the slice!

My go-to's are Frankie and Norty.

Norty (has my heart): potatoe, pesto, bacon and asparagus. Need I say more?

Frankie: sausage, broccoli & red onions.
author: Thuy N.

description: Found this little pizza restaurant while touring San Francisco and decided to give it a try. As soon as we walked in we were greeted and seated. They gave the kids pizza dough to play with while we waited. Now the pizza...it was DELICIOUS! Very tasty and fresh!! We ate it all up and then ordered ANOTHER one! Not a very big place but if u happen to be in the neighborhood, you must try it! All in all Great PIZZA!
author: Arturo R.

description:
We went here after the super bowl- very close to their closing time. They paused their shutting down procedures to serve us. No complaints. No disgruntled or frustration from them- even though we sat down 2 minutes before they closed. They were extremely friendly and the food was delicious. 

To top it off, they gave us a few free slices that were remaining from the day, a gesture much appreciated. We don't live in the area, but when we come to city, we will be sure to return here. Thanks again guys
author: Louis P.

description: I had the day off today, so I figured I would explore the city. I haven't been to this part of the city before and I came across this place just by walking by. When I walked in they had a lot of pizzas on display that looked really good! I went with a slice of the Bianca, (they didn't have a sign on it so sorry if it's actually called something else) which is a white cheese pizza with pesto on top, and quite honestly it was the best pizza I've ever had, like ever. Which is saying something because I reallllllly love pizza! I will definitely be coming back and hopefully with friends.
author: Korra B.

description: LOVE this place! Consistently perfect NY style pizza! My go to pizzas are the Widow Maker and Margherita. I highly recommend!
author: Linda C.

description:
Friendly little joint in the heart of Lower Pac Heights?

- Garlic knots.. check
- Sicilian slice.. check
- Regular thinner crust.. check
- A quick 2-slice and drink for under $10.. check

Seems like everything checks out! 
Surely excited that Presidio is in the neighborhood - it's a breath of fresh air in a sea of newly styled joints with variations of mac'n'cheese on their menus. The owners here are really friendly and it's the perfect food spot to get together on a quiet Saturday afternoon. Pizza is tasty, crispy, and unpretentious.. the way you'd get it at your favorite corner joint back in Little Italy, NYC... or on Divis, in SF.
author: Jade T.

description:
I'm writing this yelp review to send my apologies to the owner for drunkenly telling him I did not like the special sauce. But my words were true...the pizza really WAS so good it didn't need the special sauce. Don't mess with a good thing!

Also, I went to put red pepper flakes on my pizza and someone pulled the old trick of leaving the top unscrewed so the entire contents of spicy flakes fell onto my pizza. I was still gonna eat it but the worker behind the counter came in and swooped it so fast and produced a brand new slice for me!

Grand place! Just grand! (again, sorry for offending the owner's sauce)
author: Kelly G.

description: My boyfriend and I ordered take out a little over a week ago and we were extremely disappointed. We didn't get the pizza we ordered -- they gave us a cheese pizza (which is cheaper) with the toppings we ordered rather than a margarita pizza. We called to ask about the mix up. We were told to check the box -- it had my name written on it -- and then we were asked if we wanted to wait another 45 minutes for a new pizza OR get a refund. We asked for a refund. I've waited to post this review because I know it can take 5-7 business days for refunds to post through the bank. Today is day nine. No refund. Needless to say, we are not ordering from them again, and we're calling to get our damn refund. So unimpressed, Presidio.
author: Erin D.

description: I like this little spot. I went to the one on Divisadero. The pizza and wings were good, they had a happy hour, and the staff was great! My server was this girl with curly reddish/brown hair (so she hopefully gets credit :)). She was good at her job and genuinely friendly and sweet. Other folks working there seemed nice too. I'll come back for sure.
author: William A.

description:
Wow was there a change in management? The atmosphere is completely different. Our group usually comes in once a month and order pizza and beer around 10:30. We use to be welcomed and staff was really friendly. It was like being at home and we've continued to enjoy this place. A recent visit- we were told that we had to be done with our beer before 11 and they were only doing slices. 

The guy in the beanie was pissed we even got beer. He has a conflict with the lady that let us order. Then they burnt most of our slices. The guys who came in after got free calzone  and beer...with an apology. 

It felt like the staff were like "okay we will tolerate you all as customers." It sucks when a welcoming place changes and you suddenly feel like you are on your toes when eating burnt slices. 

Maybe it's because we smell after kendo?
author: Wendy L.

description: I've eaten here a few times and the pizza and calzones are always great, really good quality cheeses and meats. Arguably on the greasy side but you don't go to a pizza place to be healthy after all. One downside from my experience was the chicken wings. They were not the best but the calzone made up for it. Would definitely go back.
author: David S.

description:
Today was soft opening day and for sure they are working out some kinks.  They have table service and a counter for slices (though looked like some people were getting slices at the tables - which I think they are trying to rectify.

The selection of pies to order by the slice was limited (and even though they tout "3 different pizza stylings" - they all looked pretty similar to me, and several had the same topping choice of pepperoni - like I said they are working out the kinks.  The cashier was obviously still in training and wasn't sure which pizza was which.  But hey - learning curve, i am just thrilled to have pizza 2 blocks from my house!

I believe I had a Sicilian slice (with pepperoni of course) and it was well cooked - top quality cheese and a nice brown crust. I believe it was $3.50 which is totally fair.

Suggestion - Please provide (regular) black pepper - maybe even a pepper mill for the slices - I know you have the red pepper flakes, but I like BOTH ;)

I am very much looking forward to trying their "sandos" and full pies. I am worried though that once the Drew High School students catch wind of a slice place nearby - they will be overrun at lunch time.

See Tablehopper article here: http://www.tablehopper.com/chatterbox/first-look-at-presidio-pizza-company-soft-opening-december-19th/
author: Amy W.

description: The Bianca is where its at. Deliciousness. I had a bianca, a frankies, and a Breckle's Brown (anchor Brewing Co.) the three together were a great lunch. $17 for the three, not a bad price. Food was good, ambiance was good as well.
author: Brian R.

description:
Gonna move up my rating since I guess they were just having an off night a few months ago.

The dude at the register and the dude who handles the pizza are young, friendly, and funny. They don't let the drunken 12:00am crowd get to them and instead make light of the situation with jokes and playful banter. They bring personality and character to the restaurant / brand. 

The pizza itself seems to have improved. The other day I got a ricotta + pesto slice was that very good. I still think the toppings could be a bit better, maybe more like Escape from New York Pizza, but the overall slices are pretty good.

I'd definitely take a single slice of Presidio Pizza over Pizza Orgasmica or Nizzaro's.
author: Peter T.

description:
Great service!!! Good food. Lovely location. Driving around San Francisco. So hard to find a parking spot. Finally got one and happened upon this place. Would definitely come back. 
My daughter spilled her drink & the guy was so sweet to her.

Also great beer!
author: Young A.

description: This place was recommended by our hotel desk. We ordered for delivery, sausage & bell peppers. We also asked for pepper flakes & parmesan cheese, we did not receive either. The man told us one price on the phone & when the delivery arrived it was another price. That would not have been a problem if the pizza was actually good. I took one bite of this pizza & spit it out it was so bad. No flavor & the cheese was chewy. Very disappointing.
author: Richard J.

description:
I've been twice, and I like the pizza. We could definitely use a good (and not exorbitantly-priced, ahem, Delfina) pizzeria in the neighborhood. The former Frankie's Bohemian Cafe space is completely renovated, and is nice and comfortable. Both times I've come for takeaway, and grabbed slices. 

The first time I had lots of options, and took home a slice of cheese sicilian, a slice of grandma's pizza (tomatoes, garlic, pesto), and a slice of Frankie's (sausage, broccoli rabe, hot peppers). The service was a little slow, and recognizing this, the server dropped me an extra slice of Frankie's, which was great. 

The second time I visited, there were only the scraps of a few pizzas left in the case, so I had less options. I think I ended up with roughly the same combo as before, but mostly because that's all that was left. (This was right around noon on a Saturday.)

The pizza itself is pretty tasty. My expectation for "sicilian" is a thicker crust, but theirs is thin and plenty good. My experience with grandma's pizza in NY is that it's more about garlic and big chunks of crushed tomatoes, but Presidio Pizza makes theirs with a thinner tomato sauce and a dollop of basil pesto on top. It's tasty, just not what I expected.

Bottom line: friendly staff, tasty pizza, great addition to the neighborhood. Glad to have 'em.
author: Andrew M.

description:
The incompetence of the employees at PPC is breathtaking. We have been ordering from PPC since it has opened. It is walking distance so, it makes it convenient. I have no idea why they can't get their act together after all these years. Your order is either not ready, they gave my pizza order to the wrong customer and one time they gave my order to the delivery person - it was out being delivered to someone else. If it's not one thing , it's another with them. Every time they make a mistake (which is often) like over charging, wrong order, adding a 20% gratuity , or having your order sitting on the oven while you wait 20 minutes after you already called it in because they couldn't be bothered to even look for your order. They are so rude and get mad at you when they make a mistake. The customer service is horrible. I'm am done with them and I'm not the only neighborhood customer that have decided not to patronize Presidio Pizza. Convenient or not it's not worth the aggravation. I'm sure I'm wasting my time writing this review. Clearly the manager/owner has no interest in serving their customers with quality service and providing a nice neighborhood experience.

The final straw was I order two pizzas for my kids sleepover. I paid with a credit card over the phone because I thought the kids would walk over and pick it up. It was pouring so I decided to drive and pick it up with one of my kids. The pizzas were ready and was ready to sign for it when I noticed an 18% gratuity on it . I asked if that was new. I had a cash tip that I was going to give them. He fiddled with the register and kept saying I don't know why the computer did that (was it because I told you over the phone kids will be picking it up) He ended up voiding the order and needed the card . I didn't have the card with me. I told him we come here all of the time and can I take the pizzas home. I have a bunch of starving teenagers. I will call you with the number. I live two minutes away. He and female co-worker (who was absolutely worthless) said "we can't do that" . I was like we are not going to rip you off. I had my kid with me. I hate places that come from a place of no. No help , no solutions. This is not the first time I have had a run with this guy (typical hipster/poser dude with his  dark rimmed glasses , short dark hair, and bad attitude) PPC do your business and the neighborhood a favor and get rid of this guy. Too bad we can't have a nice neighborhood place to go and have a nice experience. The ownership clearly don't care about service and it shows since the place is pretty empty these days. I know at least two other families that will no longer darken the doorway of PPC again.
author: Rob M.

description:
Really good New York Style pizza. I have to say that I really liked the crust. Chewy without being overly so and crunchy without being burnt. 

I also like that you can buy by the slice. Hubby and I were hungry but weren't going to finish a whole pie. We were also walking and so didn't want to carry s pizza box around. So we just got a slice each and it was perfect as a snack. 

The Widow Maker was really good. Slightly salty but then again is has multiple types of meats on it. 

Slices are $3.50 - $4.50 ish.
author: Mariko F.

description:
Updating my review after another experience with The Presidio Pizza Company. 

A month or so back we had a pretty gnarly experience--a super long (2 HR) wait for a pizza and salad to be delivered on a night when the weather in SF was horrible. 

The manager, Johnny, apologized and offered a free pizza to make up for it. A few weeks later we decided to give it another try. We really do love their pizza! Delivery was much faster and reflective of typical food delivery times. 

My previous review was written in anger and haste. We had placed our order through Eat24 - an app from the good people at Yelp. The food service industry is going through some growing pains while trying to adopt new technologies as a means to scale and reach more people. While there are certainly things restaurants can do to mitigate risk when adopting new technologies, sometimes shit happens. 

I'm really happy we tried Presidio Pizza again and hope that apps like Eat24 can figure out how to help their partner restaurants avoid situations like we experienced. They owe their restaurant partners that courtesy.
author: Alex H.

description:
Was immediately disappointed by how the pizza slices looked on the display window...mainly because i'm a fan of super thick and fluffy pizza crusts. 

Gave the Bianca a chance anyways because all pizzas deserve love~
#equality #nosliceleftbehind #pizzaqueen 

It was good! Not "amazing like wowow shed a tear and dance because it's delicious" good but, simply good. 

Lessons for your children: don't judge a pizza by it's looks or crust size. theee end
author: Crystal B.

description:
Honestly, I don't understand why this place has such a good rating. Simply put, the food isn't good.  Like really truly disappointing pizza. Maybe it was a bad night, but I don't even know if what we got in our order can actually be considered "pizza".... 

We ordered The Grandma, the kale caesar, sliders and the garlic knots.  The pizza did not actually take like pizza. It tasted like overly-sauced focaccia bread with a bit of cheese. Honestly, I am not even sure you can actually properly call it pizza. The dough was too dense; the pizza had WAY too much sauce and not at all the great melt-in-your mouth pizza experience. 

The kale salad left much to be desired. It's literally just some raw kale -- not seasoned or massaged or marinated properly, and some dressing. 

The knots had the same problem as the pizza -- way too "bready" without any flaky texture. Even the ranch dressing is not up to par. 

Eating pizza is a rare treat for me, and I was really disappointed. I barely even finished one slice.
author: Smartwater o.

description:
God damn this is good stuff. Interesting flavors, too. Have the sausage/broccoli and the ricotta/pesto.

Wow.
author: Eric K.

description: The Round Pepperoni Pizza Pie is da bomb and saved my life tonight! I nearly ate the whole thing myself. True story
author: Tauasa T.

description: Such a neat little place. Makes you feel like you're in a New York City pizzeria. The norty is by far the yummiest slice that they serve. Topped with potato slices, it's something special. The house made hot sauce was so yummy that I wanted to buy a jar of it, but sadly they don't sell it like that yet. The owner did let me take a small container filled with it home though. Great pizza in a quaint, and homey atmosphere.
author: Dara R.

description: 2 stars because of a good salad.  For the first 3-6 months this place was really good.  Haven't been there for about 3 months and just ordered delivery.  First off we had half pepperoni but they put it on the whole pie.  Second there was no corn meal on the bottom, not anymore.  And worst of all the pizza was not even edible without 20 min in my oven.  Seriously if the cook thought this pie was done he has been serving un cooked half cold pies to the neighborhood.  No wonder why they only have 3 stars. Once a really good pizza place is now a shitty run of the mill pizza place....thats priced like top knoch pizza.   Save your money and go to Arnels.  This place sucks now, they will be closed in 6 months if this is the product they are selling to the neighborhood.
author: Dj S.

description: The pizza is ok for San Francisco. They definitely added a dollar to my credit card receipt, which I believe is referred to as "fat fingering." I wasn't offered a receipt, but I tipped one dollar cash on a $8.90 credit card transaction. My credit card statement now says I was charged $9.90 for two slices. So someone definitely decided to pay themselves an extra dollar. Overall I paid $10.90 for two slices of just ok pepperoni pizza. I know it's only a dollar but, come on, don't steal from your customers.
author: Kevin M.

description: I absolutely love this place for lunch! It's a farther walk from where I work but on the nice days in the city, I'll make the stroll here because the pizza is delicious. It's not as inexpensive as other pizza by the slice places but you Know what you're paying for!
author: Suria S.

description: Subpar pizza, unorganized ordering process, and extremely rude staff. Avoid!!!
author: Geno B.

description:
Really awesome crust and lots of options. Be careful though. That is one HOT pizza! 
I had the potato and bacon. Of course I wanted more bacon but had great flavor. Nice find on Divis.
author: J F.

description:
Just giving you 2 stars because you told the cook he could sell me a slice at 10;45 am, even thought the sign said "yes we're open".
It's always amazing to me how clueless people are that run businesses like a pizzeria.  There are a lot of pizza joints out there and I don't have to buy your $5 slice.
All you needed to do was say hello as I stood there, maybe a thank you when I left.
Just acknowledge a person standing 3 feet away from you, especially if they are spending money on your shop.
Sorry bud...personality no stars.
 you aren't a very cheery guy.
I grew up in a pizzeria family owned for 50 years...you greet your customers and say thank you and smile.
author: Hip P.

description:
Disclaimer: This review is about the service, NOT the pizza. However because the person who I spoke with was so incredibly rude we will likely never go back (not that they care).
Ordered a pizza around 5:30, SUPER loud in the background and the guy was apologetic at first. Lots of kids there, totally get it. They were busy. I understand what that must be like for sure. I had to repeat myself a few times to clarify and felt pretty sure he got everything I said.
Cut to over an hour later, no pizza to be seen or heard of. I decided to call back to politely check and the guy basically blamed me for why the pizza had not come. He said "I see this happen all the time, you need to pay attention to your phone. I don't know what to tell you, the driver called you, she even knocked. She called you." I repeatedly said she didn't call me, I have had my phone the whole time, and instead of trying to clarify my number or address or anything, he continued to blame me, tell me she called me, and get extremely defensive. I would understand if I was rude when I called, but it's definitely not my style. He then continued to tell me that I need to pay attention to my phone, he didn't know what to tell me, and that they could send it back out. I repeatedly told him we didn't have a buzzer and that is why I need the call, I live in an apartment on the 3rd floor so I wouldn't hear a "knock on the door" that allegedly happened. He tried to hurry up and hang up on me after grunting several times that it would go back out. He even had the nerve to say to me "you act like I am trying to persecute you" to which I said "it feels like you kinda are actually." After all that back and forth I stopped him just before he tried to hang up on me to clarify that he had the right number, turns out he WROTE DOWN THE WRONG AREA CODE for my phone number. He was not apologetic but rather seemed upset with me that this happened. I tried to make sure the rest of the number was correct and he hung up on me. I honestly cannot believe how someone could be so rude when unprovoked and when it wasn't even my fault. 

Fast forward to 2 hours later, food still not here. My boyfriend called to check and cancel the order and this go around the guy was extremely polite, apologetic, and offered free soda.
My guess is if I would have called this guy would have still been a dick to me, but because a man called he felt it was time to be respectful.

I likely will not return to this place, they've screwed up multiple times and can hardly even take responsibility. It's not the mess up that bugs me because hey, we all make mistakes and I get it can get busy and hectic, but the lack of respect and accountability is what really makes me not want to give them my business anymore. 

AND....over 2 hours later and the pizza still has not arrived. Go figure.
author: reina t.

description: I'll eat there if I'm in the hood. The pizza's pretty good, the wine ON TAP was surprisingly tasty. Wait staff friendly and easy to communicate with. Only complaint, the door opens and a cool breeze sweeps through the room. On a cold night, it happens over and over and I hate eating a meal in my coat and hat.
author: Nini M.

description: Fantastic late night Pizza stop.  You know the one I'm talking about.  When you're out with your squad and your bestie gives you that look like "let's go stuff our faces and then have a slumber party."  we found this gem.  The staff made our visit fun.  We were even offered samples of a few different kinds of pizza before deciding.  Who does that?  Love it.  Keep up the good work and service and pizza makin'
author: Daniella C.

description:
I had a negative, awkward experience with a take-out order. One evening, I decided to grab-and-go a slice, and eat it along the counter by the left hand side of the register (as I've seen many people do and as I assumed that's what the counter is for. Maybe I'm wrong?). I've done both in the past: ordered to-go and eaten it at the counter or walked out with the slice with no issues. 

This one particular instance left a bad taste in my mouth. After taking my order (but before paying), I tell the gentleman at the register that he could simply put the heated slice on a plate and I'd eat it at the counter (and also so he didn't need to waste a to-go box). Not thinking anything about it, he looked at me and said, 'well why don't you just sit down in the main dining area?' I respond, because I was simply looking to grab and go (and also thinking I didn't want to sit alone, by myself and have a full meal). Then he repeats himself again, this time speaking in a slow, condescending tone and adds "so his staff can earn the tip". Oh. Ok. Fine. I reluctantly agree, not because I had issues with tipping but because I did not want to sit by myself at a table for two but now felt obligated to. This comment made me feel awkward since he essentially was asking for a tip (I hadn't even paid at this point so its not like I wasn't going to tip anyway). A few awkward seconds go by and he turns to me and tells me to hold on....moments later he comes back and simply declares, "Never-mind. I'll take your money. You don't have to sit down." OK..... 

I paid (and tipped) and quickly finished my slice by the counter (I should have just left). The moral of the story is: Tipping is a gesture for good service. It is not required and frankly, it is tacky to ask. 

Note to PPC - I hope these mannerisms don't continue because you'll be scaring loyal customers away!
author: Claudia H.

description:
My favorite pizza and wings delivery in San Francisco. You can't beat Tony's for sit down but this is the best delivery in town.

Not one for long, wordy reviews but if you're looking for fast, hot, delicious pizza delivered- look no further.
author: Kevin D.

description:
Super big fan of this neighborhood pizza joint. They're open til at least midnight every night, and til 2am on Friday and Saturday. That means reliably good and reliably open late night food fixes. 

Personally prefer the Bianca pizza. Yummy, salty mozz, creamy ricotta, the right amount of garlic, and a lovely zig-zag of pesto across the top. Awesome. The crust is nice and thin, and the rest of their pies sport a flavorful tomato/marinara sauce.

They've also got wine and beer, and two taps.
author: Allison S.

description: Pizza by the slice for ~$5 and open till 2am on weekends. Even thought I was starving when I ate here the pizza was just OK. The service was the same. Not sure I'd go back.
author: Andrew S.

description: I love this pizza place! I love the unique combos! My favorites are the Frankie, Morgan, and Bianca. The staff multi task and are very nice.
author: Sharon C.

description:
I am in love with this place. Thin, flavorful crusts, spot on toppings, perfect cheese-to-sauce ratio. Outstandingly good pizza (easily best in neighborhood, and a top contender for all of SF), and really friendly staff who give the best name possible to this local by-the-slice or full pie, pizza joint. When you want something in-between Delfina but way better than any other delivery place, you should certainly check this place out.

You can grab really solid standard slices or get a little more adventurous with the chili or asparagus topped ones. And in a neighborhood where almost everything closes early, Presidio Pizza Co is open until 10pm on weekdays and 2am on weeknights, which I really appreciate. I split my time between SF and NYC and I can't think of anyone else doing great by-the-slice (especially late night) anywhere north of VanNess St, and then like magic, this place appeared a few months ago and I couldn't be happier.

I've been 3x in the last 10 days! Thank you guys for existing, and doing what you do.
author: Laura J.

description:
The Bianca is bomb.com! Still daydreaming about it... Service was great at 9pm on a Monday - we never felt rushed or ignored.

Go on a Monday when no one is there and grab a few glasses of wine, a house salad and share a pizza!
author: Angelique M.

description:
Full disclosure...I can't speak for the food...just the clientele and staff.  I didn't have an opinion about the place until today.

People who pop in here tend to block the neighbor's driveways, block motorcycle parking and double park, even when there are open and legal car spaces available on the street.  I guess they can't be bothered with the extra minute it would take to be considerate.

Once in a while is no problem...a few times kinda sucks.  But, this is becoming a thing. 

So, I walked in and asked the staff if there's anything they can do, even if it's just a posted sign, to get their patrons to stop blocking motorcycle parking. 

I got an eye roll and and a "yeah, yeah, yeah".

OK.  I did all I can do and went to work.  

The thing is...I ride with a body cam AND I have a hidden camera on my bike connected to a nifty app.

When I came out from work, there was a "mystery liquid" and spit, I mean a serious loogie, on my seat.  Because of the the hidden camera and nifty app, I know EXACTLY what happened.

I cleaned my seat, rode home, washed my bike and considered my next step.  

All I can say about this place is that they are bad neighbors and inconsiderate at best.  Really slimy and petty people at worst.  

This building has had multiple businesses over the years.  They'll shut down soon enough.
author: Nadine J.

description:
Great pizza and great service. I ordered pickup and went home and realized I got the wrong pizza. I called back, they apologized and promptly delivered a fresh pizza to my apartment. Just moved to the neighborhood, definitely think I've found my new pizza place! 

Thanks guys!
author: Luke S.

description: I stopped in here the other day (had been once before) for a quick slice of pizza. I decided to go with the Morgan pizza slice, which I had gotten last time as well. The Morgan slice is mozzarella cheese, mushrooms, onions, bell peppers, eggplant and cherry tomato. It was deeeelicious! The slice is huge. It was a bit crispier than I usually like my pizza but still yum yum yummy! I will most definitely be back. I'm also curious about the other items on the menu. Their salads and sandwiches look awesome too.
author: Ilana B.

description:
It is hard to beat this place if you like East Coast pizza which has it's own unique taste.  I'm not sure if it is the cheese, spices, or whatever, but it's one of the few places in this city where I can say, wow, I feel like I'm back East.

Kind of surprised the total reviews aren't higher so I had to give these guys a shout out!
author: Damon M.

description: I usually get a slice of pizza which comes out to $4. The pizza for the price and quality is good when you want to grab something quick. The place is also great to enjoy with a few friends; employees are welcoming and helpful. I'm giving a rating of 3 since I had better pizza for the same price point. Additionally, I don't like the fact that they charge a fee when you're paying with a credit card.
author: Walter R.

description:
Plain cheese pizza by the slice was ok. It was sorely under baked. Probably could have used another ten minutes in the oven.

The slice with pepperoni and sausage on the other hand was baked perfectly. 

Cashier mentioned they have only been opened a week so I will cut them some slack. I really want them to make this work because this is going to give me one less reason to wish for trips back to NYC. Or at the very least skip grabbing pizza in NYC if this works out.
author: C L.

description:
This pizza is exactly what three-stars suggest on Yelp: it's A-OK. Nothing terrible, but nothing spectacular. Sadly, I feel like I've been seeing a lot of 3-star establishments recently in San Francisco. Maybe I'm picky, but maybe the quality isn't where it should be (I think it's truly the latter). 

That being said, this pizza is good. You can get a large pizza for around $20.00, which you can't really beat, considering there aren't a TON of quick pizza places in the neighborhood.

However, the biggest test for me in pizza quality is whether it can dominate the refrigerator-second-day-challenge (yes, that's a thing). Does anyone remember that episode of Boy Meets World where Eric just grabbed a piece of pizza from the fridge? No? Just me? Okay. Well, it was in that moment that I realized that that was one of the greatest pizza joys that needs to be experienced by everyone; Cold pizza for breakfast! Lunch! Dinner, again!

Unfortunately, this pizza does not pass that challenge. Served when cold, the spices are a little too strong and the cheese/sauce flavor is a little too weak. When hot, the pizza is pretty okay. However, it's nothing to write home about-- unless you're writing to family in Italy. If that's the case, tell your family to open an amazing pizza place in SF immediately. Per favore! We need it.
author: Gabriela K.

description: Presidio Pizza is our favorite go-to pizza spot! Consistently great pie and yummy salads. We love to order a bunch of appetizers to share like tapas. Friendly staff, kid-friendly restaurant.
author: Lola B.

description: I am always pleasantly surprised when I visit here. The service is friendly and the food is delicious. My go-to pizza is the Morgan (yummy veggies) and I love the Kale Caesar salad. My 12 year-old daughter has enjoyed coming here over the last few years and the restaurant is super kid-friendly.
author: Ellen M.

description: I've been picking up pizza here for the past two years. Awesome spot and great service. I get the combo pizza with Frankie's and Anthony's options.
author: Garner M.

description:
Let me preface this review by saying that I used to frequent PPC, as I only live 2 blocks away and I was even part of their rewards program. The pizza itself is OK, albeit very inconsistent. It's also open late, which is great after a night at the bar...but you should only consider coming here at that time. 

Here was my dining experience earlier this week:

My girlfriend and I walk into the restaurant and two workers are loudly verbally arguing behind the counter. My gf says she is uncomfortable and wants to leave, but I convince her to stay and order because I was starving; my thought was a verbal argument amongst staff would probably be short lived and we would forget all about it. Wrong. The argument intensified between the two men to the point where there was shouting and a little bit of shoving. Being the closest guy to the action, I was seriously contemplating how I was going to separate the two when things turned physical, which seemed imminent. While it never got to that point, the two continued to banter back and forth (disrupting the entire restaurant) for our stay of 1.5+ hours. 

On top of all that, our waitress never got us water, but pointed us to the "water station" where we could get it ourselves...aka a pitcher of water they had lazily placed on the counter; I had dined in many times before and this was a new practice. Two couples walked in after we did, but somehow managed to place their order before us and got their pizza before us. Also, to rewind a bit, we initially just wanted to grab a few slices and walk home, but they informed us that they had no pepperoni or cheese slices available or coming soon (at 6:30pm on a Thursday). 

Also, the cheese bread we ordered tasted like it was made in the microwave by a 5 year old. 

Don't come here unless you are blacked out.
author: Curtis C.

description: So yea I hate to say this but this pizza kind of sucked. On our last night of the trip we decided to order in to the hotel and call it a night due to our early flight the next morn. I was very disappointed with this pizza. The sauce had no flavor and there was just to much crust/dough. The ratio was all off.
author: Alison H.

description:
This place was good when it opened - its now not anywhere near the food quality it used to be. I also recently ordered a pizza for delivery and it took 2 and a half hours and was delivered cold - when I called they said there were overwhelmed with orders and couldn't deal - no apology, nothing - i'm sorry but I feel like the pizza delivery model has been proven time and time again by 5000 other places, why they can't figure it out mystifies me.

Call Victors on Polk - its way better, consistent and cheaper. 

Oh and I'm still waiting for the owner to call me back......still waiting.....
author: Wendy W.

description:
New Yawk style pizza.
But for me: it's the calzone.
Diets make you small.
author: Nish N.

description:
We ordered delivery from Presidio Pizza Company and I wasn't much of a fan of what we had.

My friend, bless her drunken heart, wanted pizza. She just moved here and didn't know what was good in her 'hood. We saw that PPC delivers and thought we'd give it a try. She wanted the Sicilian pizza, which has focaccia crust, and I didn't mind because I'm vanilla when it comes to pizza and just like my plain cheese.

I wasn't wowed. The crust was too thick for my liking and the cheese wasn't well placed, kinda went over the edges of the crust and me having "first world problems" didn't want to use a fork and knife. It also was not cut very well, half of the pizza had huge rectangles and the other half were way smaller. Their thin crust pizzas seem more up my alley, so I'd love to write an update with a better review next time!
author: Liz G.

description:
Survey:

1. Do you like Pizza?
2. Do  you go out on the weekends?
2B. Do you get hungry after you go out?
3. Do you have a soul?

If you answered yes to any of these questions then you need to go to Presidio Pizza Company on the late night for a slice. Or, a whole pizza, YOLO live a bit. Always fresh, a solid selection, and plenty of seating this is a great place to go to collect your thoughts and figure out how to get home. Reasonably priced and quick to serve your pizza, this really is an ideal stop off before heading home after going out.
author: Katie K.

description:
First time we ordered and have them delivered to our house, which was three blocks away.  After 1hr and 3 min received half warm pizza.
Half Frankie and another half was Norty.  I personally prefer little more thin and crispy pizza. Combination of toppings were brilliant. All the toppings were fresh and clean. The base sauce was also very fresh and well seasoned.  I think we should have eaten in the premises, then pizza must be taste better.
author: Anna S.

description: I love the pizza here, bottom is always a little crispy. We get the widow maker and it's amazing. I'm only giving 4 stars because the last time we ordered for delivery we were told they don't deliver to us. The thing is, this has been the only way we have enjoyed their pizza! And the man on the phone was very rude when we tried to explain that we have ordered delivery before.
author: Thomas R.

description: Stopped in here on a Friday after traveling to San Francisco from the east coast. Very clean and staff was super nice and attentive. I got a kale Caesar salad and a slice of their Norty's pizza. Both awesome. My friend got a chicken parm sandwich which she raved about. The staff was great even when a party of 20 showed up with in behaved screaming children. Would definitely go back and recommend.
author: Katie O.

description: 3.5 in and out for a quick frankie slice.  sausage, rapini, garlic, onion, cherry pepper and grande mozzarella.  nice heat, crispy thin crust, with a good chew. slightly dry from the reheat than a classic brooklyn floppy slice.
author: Rob C.

description: Love this place for both eat in and delivery. The crust is delicious and chewy NYC style - not too thin and not too doughy. The toppings are excellent too - love the quality of the cheese and sausage. My favourite is the Divis and Pie which chicken, artichokes, pesto and cherry tomato but the Widowmaker and Pepperoni are also excellent. If you're not in the mood for pizza their meatballs are amazing particularly with Caprese salad or garlic knots.
author: Amaya B.

description: I got delivery.  The pizza was cold and under cooked if at all!   They used pre-made crust and the pizza barely hit the oven.  Dominos would have been a better choice!!!
author: Michael M.

description:
A nice neighborhood restaurant - clean, wood and metal fixtures. I especially like the artsy giant wooden pizza paddle on the side wall. 

Staff are nice and helpful. You can either order a to go item from the counter, or have table service.

Space is a bit tight, which is to be expected since the restaurant is small with a view of the pizza making. There is also a small area if you want to have a quick bite or a drink (wine, beer, non-alcoholic beverages).

Food is good. I enjoyed a slice of the NY-style, vegetarian Morgan pizza (eggplant, mushrooms, cherry tomatoes, onions, bell pepper, mozzarella) ($4/slice) - it was a generous portion. My friend and I shared the Kale Caesar Salad. This salad was memorable - dressed just right, flavorful, with house garlic croutons and parmesan crisps. I'd definitely come back for this salad and hope it remains on the menu. The glass of Malbec was spot on too. ($6/glass).

On a previous visit, my friend and I enjoyed the NY cheesecake - delicious!
author: Cathy K.

description: Visiting from LA and the kids loved it so much the first time that they wanted to comeback. Great service. A+
author: Oscar M.

description: So glad to find a real New York slice in San Francisco. I walked in today with high hopes and was not disappointed. The crust was just right. Firm without being tough. Quality tomato sauce and cheese. Not too greasy. I was transported home. Like I was a teenage kid with a slice of Ray's original in my hands. There's just nothing better.
author: David A R.

description:
In the former Frankie's Bohemian Café space, Presidio Pizza Company now offers fairly authentic East Coast-style pizza.

With three types available, thin-crust, round New York style; thicker, square Sicilian style; and grandma pizza, a rustic, thin, square pie that has roots in Long Island, there is something that will fulfill your pizza jones. Whether you want a slice or a whole pie, Presidio Pizza Company has got you covered.

While a little too chewy, the garlic knots ($5 for 5) were still good.  The pepperoni topped New York slice ($3.50) was nicely cooked with a perfectly toasted crust.  A little soggy along one side, the thicker Sicilian slice with meatballs ($4) was slightly undercooked.

As is typical with newly opened restaurants, Presidio Pizza Company is still working out kinks in its service. The line moved a little slowly, and the cashier did not seem to know which style if pizza was which. A little staff training and some time to get experience will surely remedy these problems.

With only Peroni, Anchor Steam, and Coors Light on tap ($5), the draft beer program could be up-leveled.  However, all is not lost, as Ballast Point Pale Ale, Big Daddy Speakeay IPA, Deschutes Mirror Pond, and Lagunitas Little Sumpin' Sumpin' are available by the bottle. Obviously, wine is not a focus, as there will only be a few wines on tap a limited number of Italian selections by the bottle.

Once Presidio Pizza Company straightens out its service and learns the intracacies of its pizza oven, it will be a welcome addition to the neighborhood.
author: CJ G.

description:
Great place to get a slice!  

Now I moved here from DC, home of the "jumbo slice", which is pretty much the most terrible by the slice pizza on the planet. So my expectations are easily exceeded when it comes to by the slice pizza. 

We got three slices for $14. The best one had onions, peppers, spinach, garlic, and sausage. It was ridiculously good. I also tried a pepperoni pizza but it had a little too much cheese and all the oil from the cheese and pepperoni kinda turned it into a congealed rubbery mass, but it wasn't bad. We also had a veggie slice that was great! They chopped up the veggies super fine so it wouldn't create a soggy mass (which is my biggest complaint about veggie pizzas). 

Open til 2:30am on fri-sat!  We'll be back again for sure!
author: Alison H.

description:
I'm going to say something controversial: this may be the best pizza in San Francisco. 

I consider myself a pizza connoisseur. Seriously, I've worked at the best pizza places, I make amazing pizza at home, but this place tops anything I've had here in SF.

The key seems to be how authentic the ingredients are. Even the cheese is unique. This place nailed it.

As for the reviews above anyplace just starting has to get service sorted out, but I'll tell you their recipes don't need any work.

Once again: this place has the best pizza in San Francisco, and that is my firm belief.
author: william k.

description: We have been meaning to check out PPC since it opened, so we finally popped in for a casual Tuesday night dinner. To our disappointment, we were served crappy pizza with a side of crappier attitude. This is some of the worst pizza dough I have ever had - chewy, stale, and flavorless. The toppings sound good on paper but come well short of all expectations - not fresh, flat flavor, utter disappointment. The servers act as if they are doing guests a favor just by taking their orders - never mind if one wants another beer or god forbid a water refill. Do yourself a favor and grab your slices elsewhere. Frankly, any Safeway frozen pizza far outperforms the poop-pies they sling at this joint.
author: Blabla B.

description:
Everything about this place is very welcoming and relaxing.
All the staff are super friendly (especially you in the Reebok Classics)!!!
Great flavor in the pie, but unfortunately the crust was just a little less airy to my liking.
Don't get me wrong though, for SF.........
It's a super solid Pizza and I definitely will return.
author: Evan E.

description: 4.5 stars. I love this local pizza spot, and although it's not a complete replacement for Frankie's, the change in format is welcome. They have the refreshingly balanced Peroni on tap! Their meatballs app is perfect. Make sure to get at least one for every meat eater at the table, otherwise things could get a bit awkward. I really liked the chopped salad. It's big so easily could be shared by 3 - 4 people with other apps. The pizza is fantastic. I personally think it's a cardinal sin to not get red sauce, and I tend to customize my pizza further than the menu options which is no problem because there are so many add-ons you may choose from. There's spicy sauce at the table, and the service is top-notch polite. There is only one TV in the place, so if an important sporting event is going on, you may not get close to it. Can't wait to return.
author: Brian J.

description: Boring and rather flavorless(skimpy on the cheese)......Fast delivery though.
author: rich f.

description:
If there's one word to describe Presidio Pizza Company, it's inconsistent. I frequent the neighborhood and have been here on several occasions. Only once have I been completely pleased with both the pizza and the service.  On other occasions, I've had very slow service, confused servers, cold pizza, slices stacked in a small box and ruined, and just meh tasting pizza. They may still be growing pains, but I expect after this long they would have figured some of this out.

If you're starving and looking for a late night slice in Lower Pac Hts, then sure. But you might be better off grabbing chips at the liquor store.
author: Jeanne M.

description:
I have been going to presidio pizza for the last year that they have been in business because it is only a block from our house.  My husband and i are originally from New York and have lived in sf for 7 years.  Our initial excitement over having a "real NY pizza place" in the neighborhood had taken a bad turn.  We first chalked the bad service and wet pizza up to the restaurant being new.  After a year of bad service and mediocre pizza we have started ordering from Mr. Pizza Geary again.  The convenience is what kept us coming back for late night pizza but after the scene that the owner of the fishbowl presented us with we will never go back again.  
We were sitting in the pizza shop on a Saturday night when the owner of the fishbowl came in and started hitting on two blond girls.  He was so drunk that he couldn't stand up. He was so loud that my husband and i just left,  never to return.
author: Cathrine S.

description:
Salad was good for late night, croutons a little stale. Pizza itself was sour mush, barely any sauce, the cheese was like melted crayon

If it's late and this is the only option, go to bed hungry.
author: Mohammed I.

description:
Pizza is ok. Nothing to write home about. Especially if "home" in New York, Boston, New Haven, Chicago, or even the Mission District. 

Note that they don't always honor their hours. They are supposed to be open until 11pm on weeknights but if it's slow they'll shut down well before 10pm!
author: David C.

description:
Food was 3 stars, service was 5 stars. 

Came here with brother and my two young nephews. 

The waiter was extremely nice and brought out crayons and dough for my nephews to play with while we waited for our pizza. 

We went on New Year's day and they said the night before they had run out of sausage, so we got a half cheese, half meatball pizza and a order of garlic knots, with a guarantee from the waiter the knots would be right out so we could start entertaining/feeding my nephews. In the end the knots came out after the pizza, which took about 25 minutes. 

I live in New York now so obviously I'm not trying to compare the pizza to that, but even for California pizza, I think it was very average.
author: Leon S.

description:
Love Frankie's!  That one is my fav.  We've ordered more take-out from here than anywhere else.  The whole pizzas are fantastic.  Slices are not as good but so it goes...

Got the meatballs and Caesar salad awhile ago and it was great.  Tried it again recently and wasn't as hot.  Sticking with the pizza.
author: Rachel S.
