description: We love our neighborhood pizza place. They have everything we need. Kid friendly casual environment. Balls of dough for my toddler to play with. Delicious gluten free crust for my gluten sensitive daughter. Cheap happy hour slices for my growing 10 year old boy. Great red wine and healthy salads and a variety of slices for us parents. Plus a tv playing ESPN for my husband when he needs to watch the game at dinner :)
author: Lucy M.

description: My favorite pizza in the city!!!! It's the best, I come here at 12pm I come here at 2am and the Bianca pizza is amazing everytime!
author: Shelby F.

description: I don't care what anyone else writes.  I've lived in this neighborhood for 24 years and I've seen restaurants come and go.  I've even had some of my favorites disappear which seems to be common among the local neighborhood small restaurants these days given the greedy-landlord situation.  The folks at Presidio Pizza rock.  The food is great, consistent, and they deliver to me right around the corner when I don't feel like going out.  They are always nice, always customer service oriented and I love the food.  Their meatball pizza is my son's favorite and I like all their wacky cool combination pizzas (The Frankie and Bianc are two of my favs).
author: Lynn A.

description:
In my initial review, I mentioned that there were a couple of kinks to be worked out after their opening. As of yet, they don't appear to have worked them out.

The pizza is still decent but the service seems to have dropped off a bit.  I think whereas they might have been overmanned at first, they certainly seem undermanned now and overwhelmed during the lunch time rush. The last time we tried to sit down for lunch, we had a hard time getting our orders in, as the waitress had to serve all the tables and work the register, while taking orders and getting drinks. We eventually had to leave before ordering. 

My advice would be to avoid the lunch time rush and if you do go at a busy time, order at the counter.
author: Baron C.

description:
The pizza is good. It's not FANTASTIC. But it's still QUITE yummy. Plus, you can get slices of it (I recommend mixing and matching) to go, which gives it a gold star over other local joints like Delfina and Dino's.

But the BEST thing about this place is the service. The people working here are some of the nicest, most generous humans in SF. Listen, Delfina pizza down the street is better. BUT, you also have to wait for like 2 hours for a table there, AND they don't have take-away slices, AND I always feel like the servers are always super over-worked and just want me to order my pizza, wolf it down, and getthehellaouttathere, because my rump is taking up prime Pizza-Consumer space. I totally don't blame them. But it stresses me out.

At Presidio Pizza Company, they welcome you in, they want to chat with you, they want to tell you all about their pizza, they want to help you deliberate between their awesome choices, and they put on a pretty good show of thinking that you are a nice, interesting person rather than a Super Annoying Waffler Who Can't Make Up Her Damn Mind About What Pizza Slice to Get (which is what I actually am, but they never let me see they're on to me). 

One time when I went there, I was awaiting the amazing chicken parmesan sandwich I'd ordered (now THAT item, my friends, IS in fact better than any I've had anywhere else). I was standing awkwardly in the corner reading my book. Did they say "scram, nerd-girl, you're taking up space and looking awkward?" Nay. They gave me a complimentary glass of wine. Another time I went, I was a bit sick and my tummy simply didn't know what it wanted. I hummed and hawwed about different slices and couldn't for the life of me decide. Did they say "this is not a life or death decision, figure yourself out you pathetic victim of First World Problems?" No. The dude at the counter said "you know what, BOTH choices are good. I'll get you The Bianca AND the Widow-Maker, but only charge you for one. That's how much I know you'll like them both!" And you know what? They were BOTH good. But I also wanted to hug this incredibly generous person for putting up with my bullshit. I did not do so, however, because, you know, illness and personal space and intervening countertops and all that.

So come here for pizza, because it's very good and there's no wait and the people here ROCK.
author: Ali M.

description:
We ordered the pepperoni pizza, sorry guys but the pizza is not good.  I really wanted to like this place since it's in the neighborhood but I'd rather order from Extreme or Round Table.  

The ingredients are garden variety, bland and flavorless.  The service was great and everyone was friendly but the pizza has zero character.  We won't order from here again.
author: Ben M.

description: My son begs for this pizza.  We've been going to the restaurant since the day it opened.  But stormagedon 2014 had our power out and theirs....they still had the ovens fired up ... got a text from them that they were open and if we wanted to "wait out the blackout" with them to come on over.  And if we brought them candles, we'd get a free coke.  My son and I walked over with candles, ate one of the best meatball pizzas of our lives  with our free cokes and we've been die-hard customers ever since.  Love their addition to our hood!!!!
author: Lynn A.

description: Great pizza and great buffalo wings. I had a slice of the Bianca when I went. Yummy and it hit the spot. Their pizza is thin crust style and there are lots of options. I will go back next time I'm in the area and want some pizza.
author: Gina G.

description: This very mediocre pizza showed up cold an hour after the estimated delivery.  DO NOT waste your time and money.
author: Glendon R.

description:
It's crap.  I reluctantly ordered a square Grandma Pie from them and immediately regretted it.

First off, these poseurs obviously know nothing about the neighborhood, because this isn't the Presideo and nobody with half a clue would even confuse this area with the Presideo. 

Second, the price.  The pie cost about $50 (Delivered by Caviar).  I could have had a better and larger pizza from Tony's Pizza Napolitana for about the same price and Tony's pizza is delicious.  What a rip-off!

Third, and most important:  the food.  Quality is simply not there.  The flavors were bland and the crust tastes like cardboard, not fresh baked bread.  This style pizza is inspired by Roman pizza joints/bakeries that have delicious crusts.  You won't find any flavor or texture here.  It's just garbage.

Lucky for the owners, this neighborhood is filling up with doofuses from BFE who have no idea where the Presideo is or what pizza should taste like.  Theses newbs assume high prices equate to high quality and will never understand the difference.  So, this place will linger as long as the current bubble.  Once the newbs get sent back to BFE, this place will likely turn back into a dive bar and the owners will go to another town and sell garbage to clueless poseurs under an equally stupid name.

Best of luck.

{PS}  They skimped on two of my toppings that I paid for, so they owe me money.  I was also offered $50 worth of free food by management, but declined since I honestly don't care for their pizza.
author: Lester B.

description: The all-meat pizza was just decent, but the "Grandma" margherita pizza is really tasty. If you walk in and order, your pizza is made in 20 minutes or less. And if you go to the Fishbowl Bar next door, you can bring it inside. Customer service was VERY efficient, friendly, and accommodating.
author: Maurice R.

description:
The food is good but the the stars are for the service which is slow at best and adding unauthorized tips.

At least two times now I have had a tip added to a pick up order or an order where the tip was left in cash, unauthorized. They were small amounts but overcharging is not cool. I got a salad and signed the receipt with zero tip for $9.24 and my account was charged $11.24.

Only pay with cash.
author: Bill L.

description:
Pizza good, even with delivery. I don't think delivery was free.  
Caesar salad great but definitely not what I would describe as healthy! There are delicious pieces of what I think is fried cheese in there.
Cheesecake delicious, perhaps best ever, melts in your mouth.
$47 with tip.
author: Lizbeth S.

description:
Meh pizza. Sub meh service. Pretty slow delivery time... even for a slice when you're standing right there. The one time I called in an order for delivery, when the pizza and salad did show up an hour later (I'm mere blocks from Presidio Pizza's physical location, please don't hate on the implicit sloth), driver claimed to not carry change... so I was "forced" (by convention and having worked food service before) to over-tip instead of happily giving a good tip. 

So, meh.
author: Slob M.

description:
I had a few friends visit me in SF and they wanted some pizza in the lower pac heights area since they parked around there. Found this pizza place and we walked in with no one in. We ordered slices and wow, it is delicious. 

Maybe I was drunk, but I had dinner and just one drink, and it's super delicious. Order a slice and then sit down and enjoy the great thin sliced pizza.  

I will say that someone who worked there or the owner got really creepy with the table next to us. He flirting with these two girls who came in and were slightly tipsy.  Offering free pizza, drinks and whatever they may need.  Yes, they might appreciate it, but please don't hit on someone right next to 3 attractive girls as well. It makes a girl feel unappreciated and almost not wanting to go back. However, I'll probably end up going back to go or getting it delivered since it is some great pizza. 

Next time I'll try those garlic knots.
author: Nina Y.

description:
The pizza here at Presidio is really good. Made with quality ingredients which gives it a delicious taste. 

I've come here several times for lunch, tried a few things off of the menu, and have had no complaints. 

My favorite is their "Bianca" pizza. 

Garlic, fresh mozzarella, pesto and olive oil!

Those simple ingredients make for a delicious pizza, I urge everyone to try it. 

They also have good meatballs that is paired with a delicious house marinara sauce. 

Chill place with good eats in lower Pac Heights.
author: Tiffany F.

description: Pizza was okay at best. Service was unprofessional and lacking in so many ways. Would not return
author: Jessica B.

description: Hands down ! Best slice of pizza I've ever had in my life. I had the widow maker, it won my heart and soul. With out second thinking I'd leave my wife and replace her with "WIDOW MAKER".
author: Dario. C.

description: This place consistently has solid quick pizza since they sell most of them by the slice. The crust is always perfectly crispy/crunchy and the toppings are delicious. They also have the best staff -- they're HR person has done a great job. I've actually never ate there because I live a block away so always get it to go. Additionally, the late night weekend crowd which is usually when I want pizza is a little too drunkard for me but that's expected anywhere in the city late night on a weekend.
author: Nolan M.

description:
Three hungry nurses came in (us) and the two young (men?) wouldn't even acknowledge our presence. We waited for ten minutes for someone to look up at us as the only customers in line- and they wouldn't make eye contact or speak to us presumably busy with take out customers orders. 

The one guy wore an Ed Hardy T-shirt and a cap that says DOPE in metallic letters. Yep
author: Emily K.

description: I love this place also the staff specially the pizza, Sometimes they give us free pizza at work. I recommend people to stop by and try pizza.
author: Joseph R.

description: I obviously never do this, my one review, and it's to thank John for the first class service. Thank you for everything! Great vegan option!
author: Matt H.

description:
I've definitely stumbled into the Presidio Pizza company at 2:15 am asking for pizza before but I've also come in on a Saturday afternoon around 2:00 pm. Both times I had a great experience (granted, I can't say I remember both times clearly) . The pizza is delicious; the slices are huge and I didn't think the prices were unreasonable. I usually get just cheese pizza (basics are fine for me) but I've also ordered the garlic knots. The knots were just OK. Maybe I was expecting something more? 

I don't like when pizza has too much sauce on it. Just the right amount.
author: Tommy C.

description:
This place was a godsend to the neighborhood. Late night food is few and far between in Pac Heights (although getting better) so once we heard a pizza place was opening up that served food until 3am we decided to renew our lease.

Here's the trick here...order the meatball sub. It's crazy how few people know they have sandwiches, and the meatball sub is the best I've ever had. They also have gluten free pizza options if that's what you require. Either way, perfect place to grab a slice between bar and bed, or to grab a dinner sandwich.
author: Ron A.

description:
Dear Presidio Pizza Co. establishment & chef Bumbalo..
Shalom.. 
Thank you .. WoW!!!  
Chef Bumbalo, your deliciously tasty recipes, prepared with great ingredients were so comforting for all our  bodies and souls..

*Your service with your host, hostess, waiters, waitress, they all are  super friendly.. *We enjoyed the whole experience and will all be back with more of our friends next week!! And every week..!!!:-)

XO & extra hugs,Cheers, LOL,  Family P. @ Woodcliff Rd.

PS.
~ We loved  & appreciated your inspired  Italian tradition .. You taking that extra time to warm your olives before serving.
* Appetizer : warm olives.. Umm..Umm... Yummy!!
     God Bless you all.. Amen.
author: Orly L.

description: The best pizza ever. Kate is the best!!!! They serve pizza two doors down at the bar at 11:30 pm at closing, at the fish bowl bar for free! So awesome! We love you!!
author: deena h.

description:
I got a round cheese pie delivered out to the Inner Richmond after taking the 24 Divisadero bus past their restaurant and being intrigued by a new pizza restaurant in my old neighborhood, I grew up right up the hill and shopped on Divis all the time. I was hoping they would deliver out to my area and they did!

The pizza was incredible, it reminds me a lot of Amici's cheese blend, but on a thicker chewier crust. And while I usually like crunchy over chewy in a crust, this one was perfect in every way! 

Also got the garlic knots which should be called Vampire Bombs! They were SMOTHERED in garlic, like if I would have eaten all that I would have stunk for months! Most places barely give you a few tiny shards on your bread, I think they made up for every bread I've ever had and then some! The knots themselves seemed a bit underdone in the middle, almost raw, but still edible. Could have been cooked another minute or two. Otherwise everything was perfect! 

The prices are amazing too, $18 for 18" of pizza, that is the cheapest around!
author: Venus S.

description:
The pizza is just so so but the service was just terrible. I was verbally abused by another customer and the big guy behind the counter did nothing to help defuse the situation but instead yelled at me for defending myself. And yes racism was definitely a factor as both this other customer and the server are white and I Asian American. While racism can exist anywhere, it is still upsetting to experience it in San Francisco. 

I'm a big supporter of small local businesses, but I'm really disappointed that I had this bad experience in a local pizzeria that I had previously enjoyed patronizing.
author: Peter P.

description:
Do you like flat beer on draft? Do you like paying $5 for buttered toast that they call garlic bread? If so, then this is the place for you! 

The best thing is the wing sauce you find at your table for free. The pizza has good crust and forgettable tomato sauce. Properly best after a night of binge drinking. 

Bottomline: Was completely disappointed and not in line with the 4 stars it currently boasts on yelp.
author: Chloe M.

description: Im two months back from Afghanistan and i got to say i feel good about serving when i come home to a place with beer and pizza for less than $10
author: Brad P.

description:
After the third attempt to collect two slices of cheese pizza.

Me: That refund you talked about?  I'd like to just have the refund please.
PPC:  But your pizza will be out in a couple minutes.  Can't you want to wait 1-2 minutes?
Me:  For a couple slices, I'd love and expect to just wait a couple minutes, which is what I was told OVER 25 MIN AGO when there were slices that just needed to be reheated.  But you've lost our ticket at least twice.  You have zero pizzas ready.  You didn't tell us you were going to start from scratch.  
PPC (smiling broadly): It'll be worth it
Me (somewhat apologetically): I would like a refund.  You can even keep the tip.
PPC (touching my hand and nodding a tilted head):  But it's really almost ready.
Me:  Wow. I can't believe we're still talking about this... You can keep all of it.  

And out the door we went.  NO PIZZA.  No refund.  NO WAY I'M EVER GOING BACK THERE.  

So disappointing.  I really wanted to like this place.  Even after the mediocre sandwich I had the first time, I thought it deserved a second chance.   But come on, you guys need to know how to make a simple slice or give a simple apology.
author: Rochelle R.

description:
I've never had a sit down at this restaurant. I've gotten pizza to go twice. Both times there were probably three tables with people and yet it took a while to get someone to take our order. 

The pizza is decent. Like cupcakes and sushi, there are so many options in the city. I'd say they'd fall in the category of "this is closest to where I'm at and I want pizza" if you get my drift.
author: Ashley W.

description:
I consider myself a bit of a pizza connoisseur having grown up on the East Coast where I have sampled NYC, Jersey (tomato pie!), Boston and Philly pizza regularly.   

I will simply say this - the three best pizza places in SF are Tony's, Jersey and Presidio Pizza.  Tony's might do the best tomato pie version but Presidio wins hands down in terms of the regular slices.  These are the slices we used to get from our neighborhood joints in the boroughs or east of the Parkway.    The Grandma sicilian style is insanely good too.

Finally, unlike Tony's or Jersey which generally requires a wait, Presidio is all about ease of use.  Order ahead or walk in and you will get your food quickly.    Furthermore, the service here is uniformly fantastic.  The people behind the counter are cool and if you have special requests, they make it easy.   This place is great.
author: Lou R.

description:
Got takeout today. The pizza was good, and I'll go back, but there are a few things to work on. 

Herbed garlic knots - yum! Big chunks of garlic, parsley tasted fresh. 
Slice of The Grandma - pretty thick for being 'thin' but maybe that's the way rustic is? Regardless, the dough was delicious, and the pizza, which is very simple, was good, but there was no pesto on it when I opened the box at home. Bummer. 
Slice of pepperoni - excellent!
The other two that I only had a bit of were the Frankie's - pretty tasty, but they told us it'd be on the spicy side, which it wasn't, and the Widow Maker, which was supposed to be loaded with all kinds of Italian meats and sausage, but was on the light side of meats, so while I will assume that's just the slice we had. Though, if you're going to sell by the slice, I'd think you'd make sure each slice was a good representation of the pie. 

The staff was really friendly and the place was clean. I like that the dough prep was right in view of the tables and cash register. I got everything and a soda for $25. 

I will definitely go back and try some of the other items, and maybe get the specialty pies as a whole in the future.
author: Elizabeth R.

description: Hands down the best chicken parm sandwhich in all of SF!  My favorite Sunday night dinner spot to check out.  Had the calzone last week and it did not disappointment me either.  All the food is made with top notch ingredients and the slices taste just like the way east coast pizza tastes. The staff is awesome too.  Thank goodness for an awesome pizza place to arrive near my neighborhood. Will be coming here for all my Italian fixes.
author: Michael W.

description:
A good addition to the neighborhood, but not the greatest pizza - not bad, but way too expensive. Two large pizzas set me back $52.  We got the round pepperoni and the Sicilian. 

Good friendly service behind the counter but in my two visits there, sort of questionable behavior from the cooks.  

On the first trip, I watched the server put our slices in the oven.  A few minutes later one of the cooks opened the oven, looked in, took one of the slices, and started munching on it as he walked through the restaurant on his way to take a smoke break at the curb.  Our server didn't see this, and shortly after opened the oven and started looking all around, wondering what the heck happened to the slice- - he put a new one in and was nice about the extra wait, which wasn't long.  Not a big deal, we didn't mention it and tipped per usual.

My second visit, when I arrived to pick up my pies, the chef was for some reason standing outside the restaurant with a bin of dough perched on a trash can. I'm not sure if he was throwing it away or what, but it wasn't  a terribly appetizing scene to encounter as you enter the restaurant. 

The pizza itself is just OK. Not great, certainly not bad, but crust is just meh, and  WAY too much of it (and I"m a crust eater!).  At the end of the evening when my guests left, we were left with like a pound of uneaten crust. Pepperoni was OK, no one really cared for the Sicilian - too doughy, but I did like the sauce. 

Nice ambiance.  In a pinch, I'd get a slice here again.  But all in all, Del Fina down the street is offering a better value, and if I wanted a really GREAT slice and wasn't willing to settle I'd head over to Marcello's in the Castro or Mythic on Haight.
author: Sandra M.

description:
Um can I just say how AMAZING this place is??

You just can't go wrong with..

+ Local neighborhoody feel
+ DELICIOUS NY-style pizza: it was floppy, stringy (the cheese), and FRESH.  Like we were watching them make every single part of it next to our table.  Probably the best I've had in a really, really long time.
+ Great service

1 star off for..

- Bruschetta was good, but it was basically cherry tomatoes cut in half.  That made it hard to put more than one half at a time on the bread.  WIsh it had been diced more finely so I could've put a heaping spoonful on at a time.
- Buffalo wings.  Flavor was just meh, and it wasn't sopping wet with sauce or dry either - sort of this weird in-between.

Totally a place that I will come back to over and over again.  Glad it opened up!
author: Tori S.

description: We walked to this locating withought having a clue if they were good or not. We walked in at 3pm and they were immediate welcoming and very nice. Ian was a  super host and helped to make our spring break family trip fun and memorable.  That and their pizza is the best we've had in California!
author: Jason B.

description: Came here to order a late night pizza for my family and boyfriend since we haven't had dinner yet and wanted something nearby. We ordered the herb garlic bread and a Divis & Pie whole pizza to-go. It took them about 45 minutes to get our order together before we walked over to pick it up, which is average for most pizza locations. We expected the pizza to be much smaller for $22 since most places we have gone to recently was a smaller portion for a large pizza, but this pizza was huge! I was full off of one slice! Definitely will be back because the Divis & Pie pizza was so delicious and worth it! Cant go wrong with this order :P
author: Amanda C.

description: It's a nice place to hang out and collect your thoughts. Great music in the background.  Even better than their phenomenal pizza, was their great hospitality!!!
author: Robert S.

description:
Pizza-ok I mean it's pizza but....
The Service-terrible

Firstly over charged us and didn't give the kids happy hour price until I went back up after looking at receipt, then the refund was so ridiculous the manager told me the company they use add more on to the original amount then in few days you get full refund wtf??!!! I did get what I was owed but how confusing.
Customer service was crap
I ordered pizza to go that they kept forgetting about.....I asked 3 times

Then the guy serving us was ok attitude wise but he had nerve when I asked for a small bit of ranch to say" it's usually 50 cents" you overcharged me by $12 f-ing dollars!!!
It's a bunch of fellas who haven't a clue how to run a restaurant. Go to Dino's or somewhere else
author: obgyn K.

description:
The pizza and salad were both amazing, the people working there were nice.

There was a minor mistake with our pizza, that completely wasn't there fault, and they hurried to make us a new one and gave us free slices to make up for it, all while being very nice which made them go from 4 to 5 stars.  Will go back
author: Robert C.

description:
Meh. I repeat, Meh.

We were excited because they had eggplant parmesan sandwiches. Being an east coast transplant, eggplant parmesan sandwiches are a staple at any pizza joint. Anywhere that has this on the menu, I go. Oh eggplant parmesan sandwich, how I miss you so!

Of course this place ended up "fancier" (aka san franciscan-fied, and not like your regular east coast joint), which is nice.... except we came here on a saturday around 6:30 and the place was packed already. So we waited. After about 30 mins or so, a couple of tables of 2 opened up. We were so hungry, and we were like - ohh, we're next! We kept expecting the host to come over and show us to our table. But it took them another 15 mins to come over and let us sit down. All the while we're staring at our table - quite hangry...

Since we were starvin' marvin, we decided to try a couple of slices of pizza in addition to the eggplant parm. I think we got a salad too, we were just so hungry. 

Everything was OK. Definitely not bad, but it didn't blow my mind. I am kinda picky about pizza though.

The service continued to be more of a miss than a hit. They were slow in getting our drinks (which we really needed at that point). And it took forever to flag our waitress down to get our check. 

All in all disappointing. Don't think we'll be coming back.
author: Bonnie H.

description:
I must first apologize for the negativity, BUT IT IS WARRANTED. January 22nd marked the grand opening of Presidio Pizza and it was as flat as it's primary product. As Paul R. stated, we too couldn't decide if the woman that was our server was working while under the influence or what. We were literally asked our order which was as simply as a nod of the head, not once, not twice, but three yes three separate times!!!
 
WTF!!!. $33 later for 4 slices and 2 beers and it's your grand opening??? we left never to return but certain to tell any and all that will listen about how bad the experience was. And they proclaim to have a former A16 employee there....really? That is an insult to such as fine establishment.
 Like Jeanne M stated about the service I am in agreement, COME ON this is a pizza place. It can not be that difficult to screw up.
author: h. w.

description: The pizza here is just right-thin crust, delicious sauce, lots of cheese and served up crispy.  It made this New York native very happy!  It's hard to find good basic pizza in SF and this is the place.  Pitchers of beer, carafes of wine and an amazing kale salad makes it even better.   Presidio Pizza Co also has an amazing server, Lorelei, who makes everything seamless.   All of the staff was very warm and welcoming.  This is our new favorite casual resto!
author: Jennifer T.

description:
Crust is tasty, but the slices were shockingly small and just not very good.  I had a slice of the Grandma and it was slightly bigger than a 3x5 card.  I had another slice with some very dry chicken on it. 

A NY-style slice shouldn't fit on a paper plate.  I might consider going back for a slice if they step up their game.

The service was pretty slow, so I don't think I'd ever sit down and eat again, either.
author: I AM SOFA KING WE TODD DI D.

description: Not impressed.  Pizza was meh and service was horribly slow.  Meatballs were not hot enough and the sauce was simplistic.  Crowded space and it is hard for me to be an unbiased reviewer because I don't enjoy thick crust pizza.  Tried Pizza Hacker the next day which is also new and there is no comparison. It was phenomenal and you would be remiss in ignoring this plea to compare them yourself.   This was supposed to be New York Pizza but we have had pizza in Naples, Rome, New York,and SF and this is just plain pizza maybe a notch above Costco or Dominoes.  I will not be back.
author: April M.

description: great service. very kind and welcoming and not overbearing. very relaxed setting. great place to just take a break and clear your mind and enjoy amazing pizza.
author: Grdyn K.

description:
This place, this place is amazing.

My boyfriend and I wandered in on Friday and were greeted by a super friendly staff and the most intoxicating smell of fresh baked doughy-goodness. We opted for two slices each, thinking that since it was early in the day, we could take a pizza home for later if we were so inclined - no. Let me tell you, I WISH we could have taken a pie home, but the 2 huge slices each of us had kept us full for the entire day. 

I'm unsure of the names, besides the pepperoni slices, but I'll describe. 

Pepperoni - TONS of meat, you can tell that they place them on there in nice little rows, I'd say there were 4 piece of pepperoni at the top of the slice and worked it's way down to 1 at the tip. (Which should tell you about the scale and quantity!) Delicious, everything about it, especially the amount of quality of that sauce.

Caprese like Slice - All the ingredients were fresh and the flavors were balanced, less sauce on this one, but still fantastic.

Pesto w/Ricotta - This was my favorite, I'm not sure what types of cheese were used other than Ricotta, but it was thicker than your standard mozzarella - in a good way, not like the I'm going to choke to death on all the diary rushing down my throat kind of way. This one was a little greasy, but I want to say that was olive oil on top, it definitely wasn't oozing out of all areas on this one, just a little runoff on the top. 

All slices were really intense in the flavors they packed and I would honestly say the sauce was my favorite part, they used just the right amount and it was nice and rich, overall. The crust was also pretty solid, not too think and not too thin, it was just enough to hold the toppings up but light enough to bend my slice in half for optimal hand to mouth delivery. Overall, good crust, great sauce, fresh toppings, and only 1 napkin was needed!

I think for all 4 slices it was about $16 bucks, without tip - but HUGE slices. As a passerby I'd buy one instead of two, next time. :)
author: Chris P.

description:
My family and I decided to try this place out one weekend. Long story short, they failed to bring us the calzone that we ordered, brought us extremely garlicky bread and the lady next to us had the sticker left on her tomato! 
The only reason I am not giving it 1 star is because the waiter was so nice and gave us 2 free slices of pizza.
author: C B.

description: Very good pizza. Reminds me of that east coast flavor. Definitely going back again. Tried the cheese and pepperoni.
author: Eric S.

description:
GREAT PIZZA & APPETIZERS.  Had dinner there last night, and it was great from start to finish. Had the bruschetta and warm olives, both fresh and delicious. The pizzas had a crisp, fresh baked bread crust, delicious sauce, and heaps of fresh toppings. Delicious!

They have a small, but eclectic, wine and beer list. I had a great Pinot Grigio from Coppola, and a nice Napa Cabernet, both very reasonably priced.  HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!!!
author: Samuel B.

description:
My husband and I were fans of Frankie's Bohemian Cafe, so we were a little skeptical of its replacement.

Presidio Pizza did not disappoint though.  We ordered a slice of the Grandma, a chicken parm sandwich, and the Genova Italian Tuna salad.  It was all delicious!  The Grandma was nice and garlicy, which I loved, and the salad was light and very flavorful.

My husband is from Boston and is a chicken parm connoisseur.  He's always looking for a place with the right combination of chicken, sauce, and bread.  We both waited in nervous anticipation for his sandwich to arrive and I was so happy to see the look on his face after the first bite.  He voted Presidio Pizza the best chicken parm in the City -- better than Miller's East Coast.

They're still ironing out the kinks.  Once the cashier is familiar with the menu and they have everything set up, the place will be 5 stars for sure.

It's a great new addition to the neighborhood!
author: Robyn P.

description:
Atmosphere is nice! Rustic charm! Staff is friendly, our waitress was so sweet and was constantly checking up on us. Now the important part, the food. Pizza is so great!! We had the Sicilian on focaccia bread! The bread is fresh and so soft, sauce looks like it's made in house, fresh tomato taste! Pepperoni clearly sliced here (different pieces were slightly different sizes, which was nice). I'm from LA but when I'm
back in town I would love to come back for a bite! Oh , also open till 230 am on weekends... Amazing :)
author: Cynthia R.

description:
Incredibly. slow. meal. The waitstaff was great, but it took forever. We were seated around 7:45 pm, but didn't get our (one) pizza until after 9:30 pm.  The kitchen was filling many delivery orders and it was well over an hour before our pizza was even started (we were next to the pizza oven, so it was easy to watch like hawks).

The food was good- we split a tasty caesar salad, which was still a full plate for both of us. The garlic knots were just okay- pizza dough brushed with garlic. The pizza was delicious- we had the Grandma and loved it, but it was supposed to be rustic thin and the dough was definitely the normal not-thin version.  We were disappointed that they didn't have any pizzas by the slice left because we wanted to have a sampling of a few different types. Since we had to order a full pizza, the square pizza was much more manageable of a size for our small two-person table.

Three stars instead of two for all the efforts they took to make up for the super long wait. They brought us some meatballs and gave me a couple glasses of wine (one was mistakenly poured by another server, but one was given because of the wait). 

I would love to come back here when they have worked out some of the logistics in the kitchen. The space is nice, the food is good, and the waitstaff was fantastic.
author: Tara M.

description: Josh & Frank bring customer service to another level.  The service I received was exceptional!!  The pizza was amazing. I asked Josh & Frank what would they suggest for 3 different slices. I was very happy I asked!  The best pizza I've had, ever!!
author: Larry C.

description:
The Frankie pizza is outstanding.  Service AAA.
Worth the wait. The smell is so enticing as you walk in that you just want to bite in.
author: Erwin P.

description:
The north divis side has been dying for exactly this type of place. 

Open late(fri and sat), cheap slice(all under $5), and great selection of quality pies! 

The sit down area can get packed so prepare to wait if you're looking to have dinner inside the restaurant. But if you live close by, worth calling in for pick up. 

I got the divis and pie, and pepperoni, both were great slices and can't wait to try the rest!
author: omid a.

description:
As an uptight New Yorker who thinks the greatest pizza places are in NYC, this place reminds me of home! Love the vibe, style and reminds me of the Bronx. Though the best pizza place for me is in Little Italy in the Bronx I still love this pizza place. Thin crust, great sauce, perfect amount of cheese and the damn CALZONES and GARLIC BREAD is just bananas good. 

It's open late and the best part they sell by slice. Did I mention someone rocking the Yankee hat all the time? That a boy! Anyhow only downfall you don't deliver near me.      :-( I'd be ordering all day every day. Thanks for making great pizza!
author: Antonio I.

description:
Excellent service; yummy chicken and broccolini w mozzarella 

Grateful hosts: what a rarity these days!
author: eric s.

description:
What a great (and much needed) addition to the neighborhood. I stopped in for the second time today, was immediately approached by an employee to help me make a decision on what to order, which can be difficult since all of their options look delish. Very cool and personable staff. I ended up going with the Divis & Pie and the Grandma, which are both the best pizza I've had in SF so far. This pizza comes closest to the much missed pizza back east, which I have yet to discover anything close to in SF. 

One of the pizzas I ordered was not ready yet, so the employee that helped me order ended up giving me a free beer while I waited, and then an extra slice for free, which was totally unnecessary since I only had to wait less than 10 minutes, but greatly appreciated and exemplified how above and beyond this place is willing to go to please their customers. Great way to solidify Presidio Pizza Co as my choice for all future pizza dinners and deliveries. 

Oh and the homemade hot sauce is fucking awesome too.
author: Griffin T.

description: The guy working behind the counter just told me and my friend "that he had no pizza left and to eat out of the trash". Honestly the pizza isn't bad but the service has been extremely disappointing.
author: Daniel H.

description:
Best Grandma.

Mine: https://twitter.com/GrandmaBetty30

Theirs: Thin crust square with homemade red sauce and just the right amount of mozzarella and pesto. Far more creative and delicious than most $3.50 slices.

Five stars for the pizza. However the grilled chicken sandwich was a disappointment. 

Good amount of subtly spicy chicken and crispy eggplant, but just two tiny roasted peppers. Balsamic glaze added a flavorful touch, but $10 sandwiches require more.

Space has undergone an impressive overhaul since the days of Frankie's. Now much brighter, open and modern.

Best bet is to spend time with Grandma. It's never a bad idea.
author: Jason B.

description:
Pizza was very good, had a great taste.

Caesar salad was very weak (taste was good, but very tiny for $10).

I read the reviews before visiting and from glancing at the slices, I would advise against them.  They looked considerably different than my fresh baked pizza, like they had been sitting out for 5 hours.

Overall, good pizza, and I will return, but no salad next time.
author: Steve Y.

description:
Their pizzas are pretty good. They have the gluten free option which is a $14 base and every topping costs individually (1st topping 'free') so when ordering a Norty or Divis&Pie pizza on gluten free, it becomes $22 each so rather on the high side.
Definitely prefer the Norty pizza. 
Caesar salad is ok but a little heavy on the dressing.
They do offer delivery which is good.
author: Van-Anh N.

description:
Ehhhh

I haven't ordered a whole pie here but I've had a couple slices and they weren't bad or great.. Just okay. 

The slices are big, crust wasn't thin and crunchy or thick.. Somewhere in between and coming from someone who always enjoys eating pizza crust.. I didn't eat it here. It didn't taste like anything. 

I heard this place was suppose to be really good so I may come back and try a whole pie but the slices just weren't good enough.
author: Shanna N.

description: The "Bianca" pizza is a must have. Cute pizza place! I would definitely come here again when I'm in the Bay area.
author: Marlene C.

description: The food is good, the service is absolute shreck. This is not the first time, but multiple times for take out, they mess up orders, make many excuses, the employee turnover is constant, and the attitude when confronted with the mistake is truly unbelievable. I always get terrible service, try again after a few months, and nothing changes. Unbelievable how they haven't gone under. Bummer, cause I do like the pizza. When dining there.
author: tom s.

description:
Absolutely fantastic pizza. I've been in SF for three months after spending the last nearly 28 years on the east coast. I grew up 45 minutes away from both NYC and New Haven, the two east coast pizza meccas. Until eating here, I hadn't been able to find good east coast pizza in SF. Presidio Pizza Company is a perfect example of exactly what good pizza should be. 

The garlic knots were good - I'm used to doughier ones that are less crispy, but they were still delicious, especially with marinara. Got a cheese pizza with pesto to give it a first go. The pizzas are MASSIVE and 2 slices is easily enough for a meal. Perfect perfect perfect crust. Great for folding in half, the only way to eat a slice. 

100% will be going back!
author: Andrew H.

description: Decent pizza, flavor is a little lacking, and crust is a little tough which keeps it from a 4 or 5 in my opinion - needs that wow factor. Overall the staff is friendly, and service was fast. I would go again for lunch, might not go out my way for this place though.
author: Renato S.

description:
This place is killin' it!

We got the Green salad and the Caesar, both were delish (practically died over the Parmesan crispies on the Caesar). Frankie's pizza was a perfect medium between a staple (marinara, sausage, mozzarella) and something a bit more gourmet (rapini, cherry peppers, garlic), and the service was warm, prompt, and generous.

Our server even came over after dinner to offer us a taste of their newly-created in-house hot-sauce (which was also amaaaazing!) and offered us a free slice to see how it tasted on pizza!

Definitely give Presidio Pizza a shot if you're in the neighborhood. Little Star could use some friendly competition and these guys are really doing it right!
author: Julia T.

description: What a disappointment. My boyfriend and I ordered a pizza for delivery at 1:30am and it arrived practically raw. The cheese was still white and barely melted. We had to put it in our oven for 20 more minutes for it to smell, look and taste like a normal pizza. Also, they used two kinds of olives, one of which is the green type used to make olive tapenade, which gave the pizza an overbearing sweet flavor of tapenade. It was bizarre. Also $30 for a medium pizza is slightly higher than other places that are far better. Never ordering from here again.
author: Mithra H.

description: Good pizza is hard to find in San Francisco for reasons that are difficult to explain.   This place is one of the better options.
author: Eric P.

description: Great service. The pizza was ok. Problem is they are in SF were pizza should be great!! The cheesecake was ok. The bread knots were tough. The eggplant parmigiana sandwich was .. The eggplant was crunchy. The sauce was bland, not enough cheese. Loved the pizza crust. Just not our taste.
author: Michellea D.

description:
Order specifics:
-Takeout 
-Round Cheese-Half Garlic/Half mushroom

(+)SO TASTY! [Delish!] 
(+) Every bite made me go "Mmm-mm-mm!"
(+) Traditional Pizza-Hand tossed 

Definitely my new neighborhood go to pizza spot!
author: Monica R.

description: Perfect crust. Perfect sauce. I'll be coming back to San Francisco for this pizza!! Great service. Nice friendly laid back guy behind counter. Yum yum. I picked the right place! So satisfied
author: Ronda A.

description: This little place is unpretentious, local, artisan, original, staffed by non-assholes, and their pizza is totally fantastic.
author: Gwen P.

description:
Went to the still pretty soft opening tonight. They were understaffed and still ironing out the kinks but the food made me really excited for them to eventually get their groove going. 
Some of the best pizza i've had in the city. We got "The Sicilian" with meatballs, soooo good. Also the garlic knots were yummy, i recommend pouring olive oil on them to enhance the flavor.
We also got the round pepperoni which was good, a tad oily, but good and they have slices!!!! 
After a night at fishbowl having a good slice will be awesome since they serve them til 2am!
Also had the cheesecake and it was served by the chef who thanked us for coming in. Looking forward to trying the Nutella Pizza after my meal next time!.

super excited for this place to get their rhythm going and to become a regular! fantastic upgrade.
author: Mallory B.

description:
If you're keeping up with my reviews, you know they are rarely positive!

Presidio Pizza is changing my trend.  I stopped there to sit down really quickly and order a slice.  Ended up getting two because I couldn't make up my mind!  If my belly were a bottomless pit, I would have had every slice they offered.  But I ordered  a pepperoni and a chicken pesto.  

Not only were the slices well-flavored and favored a New York style pizza, but I received great customer service.  The waitress with the pixie haircut was nothing less than pleasant.  

It may be well worth me travelling all the way to this part of San Francisco from Oakland, as I definitely would like to go again.
author: Di P.

description:
I don't write reviews but i feel this one is warranted. I was hoping to love this place because it's in our neighborhood and we're tired of getting on the bus to indulge.  

Unfortunately the second we walked in there, it started going down hill fast. We were not greeted at the front. They have no hostess so we didn't know if we had to wait to be seated, to order up at the front or to seat ourselves. Apparently there was a sign up sheet sitting on the counter in front of a crowd ordering pizza to go.

We ended up seating ourselves in the cozy little corner table and had to wave our hands around to get any kind of service. My fiancé ended up walking up to the cashier to put our order in, already a strike. As he was ordering drinks they didn't have our first three choices on tap and in bottle. So if you plan to be a consumer here, make sure you have 3 backups. My fiancé also poured ourselves some water because we still didn't have a server tending to us. 

Minutes  later the cashier who took our order came around and asked if we were okay and still waiting on anything. I was confused because we were still sitting at an empty table with our 1 glass of beer and two small EMPTY cups of water. 
"You mean our food?!"-Me 
"oh yes, so you're still waiting on you're food. Let me go check on that."-server.
Ummmmmm duh! Wake up you just took our order and we have yet nothing on our table. 

Our food started pouring out of the kitchen. We finally got everything:

Caesar salad- ok.
Calamari- oily half breaded tasteless pieces over a bread of arugula. Meh. Aioli sauce on the side-yum. 
Garlic knots- meh. Did not like the pool of oil it was sitting in. only ok if smothered in aioli sauce that came with calamari.  Texture of the bread hard and doughy. 
Sicilian- square pizza= gross! Focaccia crust I don't think so. It's comparable to card board. 
Grandma- I was hoping we hit the jackpot with this one because of all the raving reviews... Wrong! Tasteless cardboard pizza. tip: don't order anything square. Maybe bc it was sitting out for awhile in their display case. 
Frankie's- finally something good. Not great. 
Widow maker- well if you're an oily meat mess floppy crust pizza lover, this ones  for you.

Needless to say we won't be returning. I kind of wish we just went to round table.
author: Cathy C.

description:
Pretty good pizza (tried the meat pizza,) laid-back and no-frills atmosphere which worked pretty well during the world cup quarterfinals. Service was slow since it was one inexperienced person for 5+ tables. 

I'd still definitely go back, just don't stop in for a quick meal. They have cheap and good food and booze.
author: Sneha P.

description:
Server sat us as soon as we walked in with no wait. Got one of the specials. Was offered to more when a nicer table opened up since we were by the door but passed. Then we had another friend meet us and the server happily and easily resat us at a larger table.

pizza took a little long but when it came out, it was totally worth the wait. lots of vegetarian options but we opted for the potato one without the meat, which they were also super accommodating of. sosogood. i will definitely be back, (especially when the line for little star is out the door anyways) to try the other veggie pizzas and check out that beer selection!
author: Christina P.

description:
Pizza and calzones are ok. I was so excited to see garlic knots on the menu but they were cold and hard, not warm and soft and doughy like I would have liked. 

Service is pretty terrible. Most in our party of 8 ordered slices, but there was one couple who ordered a small gluten-free pizza. We all got served except for them. It took another 20 min for their pizza to come, at which time they asked for it to just be put in a to-go box because we were all done. No apology from the server. She seemed to be really absent-minded the whole time we were there.
author: Tara M.

description:
This is my neighborhood pizza joint so I have given them many chances to do it right but sadly they have fallen short every time.

The first time I walked in and ordered the pizza...The Widow Maker...to take home and when I got home I found the pizza burnt on the bottom. I ate it only because I was really hungry but it was terrible.

The next couple of times I had a large Divis & Pie delivered at home...both times the pizza was soggy and there was barely any chicken. It really seems like they try and cut corners with their ingredients because the meat pizzas really do not contain much meat. Seriously! I am not a picky person and it takes a lot for me to complain.

Maybe it is best to actually order and eat the pizza in the restaurant...Not sure if I will ever know because I really don't want to take the chance and waste any more money at Presidio Pizza Co.
author: Cat A.

description: Pizza was pretty good, and the price is great for such a large pizza ($22)! But I wouldn't come here to buy by the slice ($4). Only one waitress, so service was slow, but we weren't in a rush so that was ok. I would come back to pick up whole pizzas to go. The restaurant isn't very big - some 2 or 4-person tables and one 8-person table.
author: Teresa P.

description: Stopped in after checking out some of the more popular places (artichoke Bastille and uncle Tonys) and let me say that at least the cook knew how to slap pizza. Bone was consistent and wasn't riddled with thin spots like the competitors. Overall the pizza was good. They where using marsal ovens that always give a nice bake. I would return.
author: Steven A.

description:
My husband got pretty excited when I told him a new pizzeria opened that specialized in NY-style pizzas.  I wasn't sure what to expect, since it's only been open for a week when we went.  Apparently that's the period of time when "kinks" need to be worked out, right? Whatever those kinks are. 

Well, when we went, the "kinks" mostly involve items on the menu.  They were still "perfecting" the calamari so it wasn't available. So we tried the meatballs, which were moist and flavorful. The wait time was long. But I am not sure if that could be sped up or not. Maybe you are supposed to wait patiently for your turn of the oven. 

We got a pizza with half cheese and half mushroom.  The toppings were a bit salty for my taste, especially the plain cheese one. But I loved the dough! It was just perfectly chewy, bubbly, beautiful to look at, wonderful to gnaw on.  It motivated me to look up recipes on how to make NY-style pizza dough at home. 

We would go back, definitely.
author: Candice B.

description:
We love this place. We stopped in for lunch mid-December and ordered the house salad (simple but very good), the antipasto of roasted veggies, a slice of the Bianca and 2 slices of the Grandma. The pizzas are so freaking good. Fresh toppings, delicious sauces, and really good crusts with just enough chew to them.

The service was really polite and apologetic about how long our food took (it did take a long time, but I think it may have been their 1st week, so we weren't too surprised). All in all, they seem like good people just trying to serve the best food they can. Hard to argue with that.

We've since ordered food to go and the pizzas and salads taste nearly as good from the comfort of our home. We may be convenience eaters, but this is one spot where quality isn't sacrificed. Can't wait for our next visit.
author: Megan S.

description:
This place opened up not too long ago. It's very close to my place so it makes it convenient to come here. I came about a day or so after their grand opening and they still had some kinks to work out. Soda machine wasn't working, cash register had some issues, and no more take out menus. Not really big problems or anything, and well, hopefully they got those all fixed now. 

I forgot the names of what I ordered, but one was a vegetable one and the other had sausage on it. They were both their specialty pizzas. I enjoyed the pizza crust because it was thin and chewy. I also lucked out by coming when they first opened and had made my slices fresh! 

At $4 a slice, it wasn't too expensive. The slices were decent sized and definitely better than your typical pizza joint.
author: Chris K.

description: For what you get, I think it's overpriced. The pizza is alright but it was stale at the end of the night. This place is great for a late night bite since it is open late but vegetarian options are there but not plenty.
author: Paras J.

description: So disappointed...this is around the block from my house and we were hoping to have a walkable pizza place.  We did take-out, but I don't think the four minute walk caused the soggy crust, it was way too heavily sauced.  And my salad was vinegary and unpleasant.  Nicely designed space, spacey but pleasant service.  But we won't be back.
author: Robin W.

description:
The pizza was amazing. I and a lot of other people were just staying watching Giants game. There was no place to sit. But I got my pizza really fast. 

I asked girl (her name is Katya) what is the best meat pizza and she offered me Widow maker. It was really tasty. 
So when I finished my first slice I asked for another one. This time it was Divis&Pie. Best NY style pizza in town.

Go Giants.
author: Yuriy P.

description: I actually didn't try any of the pizza but I did try the grilled chicken sandwich. It was a good sandwich with chicken, fried eggplant, mozzarella, and tomato, but there was too much bread. Also needed more tomatoes. A tasty sandwich but needs some adjustments. Wish I could have had the pizza though!
author: Erin Y.

description:
Really wanted to like this place and we've tried it a few times since they've opened and have now given up. It's too bad, cause the food is pretty tasty, but the service has just been terrible and we've tried to wait a few months in between each visit, hoping it just needed time to work out the kinks and now we're just over it. 

I'll try to keep the summary of each visit short: 

First time, they had only just opened. There was a large party taking up all the tables along the wall, and we were a party of 4, so could only sit at the communal table. We waited about an hour and then asked if we could order some apps to eat at the counter by the front entrance and were given the go ahead. When we saw the communal table opening up we were getting ready to go and then we were rudely informed by a female server we couldn't do move since we had started at the counter and they gave the table away to another group. Dumbfounded, we were in the process of trying to pay and leave when the owners came to talk to us. Told us to text the next time we were coming in so they could take care of us and pay for our pizza. Nice gesture, but why put the responsibility on us to contact them when we were coming in again? Why not pay for our apps or give us a parting gift certificate? 

Second time, just me and my husband, we did NOT bother to text (actually, we were never given a number to text). Got sat right away, got our wings and meatballs (quite tasty), and then waited for an hour for our pizza... finally our server came to tell us they burned our first pizza and were making another one for us. Great, but it still took about another 30 minutes, even the tables around us commented they couldn't believe we hadn't gotten our pizza yet. The server was really nice and sent us a dessert at the end, but a dessert doesn't erase the ridiculously long wait. 

Finally, we ordered delivery. I called and was put on hold about 3 or 4 times. I was informed they didn't start deliveries until about 5 (I called around 4:30), but I could put my order in early. No problem, we weren't really wanting the food until close to 6 anyways. After I finally put the order in, I realized we needed another pizza, so I called back, put on hold again for over 5 minutes, then the manager was on the phone since they couldn't find my order and was dealing with that...can't you just take my order and put it into the computer later?  I asked that the food be delivered between 5:30 and 6, but closer to 6 and the response was 'do you want it at 5:30 or 6?' Uhh...ok, fine, 6. Food showed up at 6:15 and one of our pizzas was missing the pepperoni. Called the restaurant and the manager offered to make another pizza and send it out, but we didn't need an excess of pizza, so I asked that they just send me a gift certificate. He then responded suggested I take down his number and I could text him next time I was ordering pizza and they would take care of it. As my baby is crying in the background, I tell him I can't really do that right now and again, suggest they just send me a gift certificate, he asks for my number and email to get back to me and I haven't heard from him since and it's been 2 weeks. 

I guess they just want their guests to bear the responsibility of getting taken care of when they've made a customer service mistake. Maybe they'd rather just lose their customers instead of taking care of them on the spot.
author: Angela W.

description:
I wandered into this place after work one day and had a slice. EXCELLENT pizza. I really like the crust. So far I've tried the Bianca and Frankie's. Both were great. It's a really clean spot with a nice decor. It's great for grabbing a slice on your own or for a good sit down meal.
Oh yeah, and they have tasty beer too.
author: Mike L.

description: Order placed a little after 8:30 pm was cancelled at 9:20.  Took 40 minutes to say they could not fulfill an order. so when you are expecting your delivery call you get a cancellation call. Big BS.  If you don't have food then don't accept orders!. Too bad cause the 1st time we ordered her we liked a lot.
author: Tommy W.

description:
I love that this opened just down the street from my apartment. Probably the best pizza in town! The crust is the closest we have to NYC pizza here on the west coast. The sauce is delicious and they use a fantastic cheese. 

The first time I went we ordered off the specials menu. We started with fried cheese stick which was made with fresh mozzarella and a caprese salad with heirloom tomatoes. Then we had a margarita pizza with the same heirloom tomatoes and fresh mozzarella. It was all fantastic. Also the pizza was huge! 

I have been back a few times since and still really love it. The garlic knots are bit greasy but still delicious. 

Not to mention the price.... this place is totally worth a stop!!
author: Janette M.

description:
Good addition to Divis, but not better than pizza options on Fillmore. 

Bonus points for being kid friendly. Very good bruschetta.  

Got the "grandma's" pizza, full pie. Liked the crust (thicker than the typical ultra thin crust in SF) but wished for more cheese. 

Would have loved my wine in a wine glass rather than a tumbler.
author: Molly P.

description: Anthony's service is great when you dine in. Would highly recommend. Food is pretty awesome!
author: Subhi B.

description:
I loved this place!  Reminded me of the casual pizza spots on nearly every corner in NYC.  

Solid food (I loved the chicken parmesan sandwich and my friend said the kale Caesar was the best Caesar salad she's ever eaten), affordable prices, great service (especially our waiter, Anthony).

I will definitely be back when my next craving for some NYC-style Italian comfort food strikes!
author: jen p.

description: Awesome place in the city....best calzones.  Great food and service.  Don't forget to say hi to Chris.
author: Kirk M.

description: This is the best pizza I had ever tasted in my life better than Fat slice and Blondies put together and on top of that the service is impeccable! If you're ever in this area stop in you won't be disappointed!
author: Semetra L.

description:
PAY CASH WHEN GETTING DELIVERY!

Have eaten at Presidio Pizza more than 10x, delivered twice. Both times I have done delivery, a little extra was added to the receipt once I checked my statement. It is a difference of less than $10 but a review on Yelp would go further than trying to get my money back. 

Pizza is good, service in the restaurant is good as well. Quality of the pizza is the best in the neighborhood, but this small gesture of greed is holding me back from wanting to return.

Be aware, if you have dined here and used a credit card.
author: Adam H.

description: I loved this place but WHAT HAPPENED TO THE SERRANO PEPPERS?! :( Ordered the Anthony tonight and apparently the peppers are discontinued because of complaints. Sad news....
author: Kerri H.

description:
Oh Presidio Pizza Company how you have taken a lovely Sunday evening and broken hearts, inspired intense hanger and frustration, and crushed pizza desires.

Came in last night craving pizza and wanting to try out a new neighborhood spot with good reviews to round out a big birthday weekend.  Ordered the garlic knots and a pizza (which apparently only comes in size large btw.. how hard is it to make a smaller size people??) half Frankies, half Bianca. We even specifically asked if doing half and half was possibly and were assured it was. Perfect. Both parties, even with very different preferences in pizza, satisfied.

10 minutes after ordering we see our garlic knots come out and placed on a counter outside of the kitchen. Yay-we had food on the way! 5 minutes later.. they are still sitting on that counter, yet to have been delivered/acknowledged/eyed by anyone except our hangry selves. 10 minutes later.. the one waiter in the place finally notices them and brings them over. While glad they have finally been acknowledged, we are clearly not happy to receive 10 minutes out of the oven neglected garlic knots, but give them a chance anyway. Cold. Duh. My boyfriend takes them back to the counter, because at this rate it would have taken another 10 minutes to get any attention from the busy solo waiter and he agrees to have them reheated. About 7 more minutes pass and we finally receive our reheated garlic knots. Nothing special, but definitely better now that they're not cold and rock solid. Still, I would not waste the $/calories on these ever again.

And then for the real kicker.. our pizza comes out all one flavor. A large (which we would never have ordered in the first place had it not been the only option as we're only 2 people) all Frankie's pizza, after specifically asking for half Frankies, half Bianca. This MAYBE would have been more acceptable had they been similar pizzas- but one is tomato sauce with sausage and the other is pesto + vegetarian! Aka: hangry allergic-to-tomatoes me, was left without dinner. The waiter apologized and offered to just heat up slices of the Bianca that we were missing. Although nice that there was a solution, this was certainly not what we had in mind when we ordered a baked to order pizza. When the slices came out, not only did they taste stale (not surprising as they'd been sitting on the counter for who knows how long), they were still cold with big blocks of unmelted cheese. And this is what we get because THEY forgot to make us the correct pizza.. Even the baked to order Frankies pizza was just average. Good crust but toppings were meh and now we have a whole size large of it.

At this point we were completely fed up and asked for the bill. The waiter, who was perfectly nice (but isn't this the base expectation of a server?) took the garlic knots off our order. While this was a kind gesture, it didn't make up for the fact that literally every aspect of our meal was incorrectly prepared. And to boot, didn't even taste great once it finally made it our way. Oh and, only size large pizzas? Really? While we were wasting time waiting for cold garlic knots and the wrong pizza, we saw several SMALL pizzas taken to other tables. So glad we have now paid for a large pizza we don't even want!

So an hour of disappointment and hanger later, we will certainly not be returning to Presidio Pizza Company. If you're looking for good pizza and service, please avoid.
author: Rachel L.

description:
Their service and timeliness is awful. Pizza is fine, but not exceptional, and with the other many great options around, they will never receive our business or referral again.  We have been coming here for the last 6 months about every other week for family happy hour in an effort to support a local business. This evening, we placed an order at 5pm online for a planned delivery at 7pm.  (We ordered in advance because we have friends visiting from
Out of town, we both have babies and wanted to make sure we had our dinner after we put our babies to bed.). We received a phone call after the order to confirm the details of the order, and we confirmed for 7pm.  When we had not received our food by 730, we called and spoke with the general manager who said they were very busy tonight and they apologize that the food had not arrived, as it was "not done on purpose." He said it would be out in ten minutes (mind you, we live a few blocks away) and then asked "do you want to cancel the order?" We had been awaiting our order thus did not cancel.... However another 30 minutes later it still had not arrived so we called back and were told the owner was delivering. When you hear the owner is delivering your pizza, one presumes that he would have appropriate customer service skills and perhaps would be apologetic about the mishap with his restaurant. This owner, again, said it was a busy night... Said we could do what we want with our decision to support their business but honestly didn't seem to care one way or another. And when asked if he would compensate us for the delay and poor customer service, he responded with disbelief..."you want your pizza for free?? Um, no". We certainly do not recommend anything about this restaurant.
author: G A.

description: 3.5 - finally! a local to go/late night pizza place! Quality isn't the best but as to be expected from this type of place. thanks for a new go-to pizza spot in the neighborhood!
author: Kate M.

description: Presidio Pizza has become our go to pizza for delivery. The pizza is good and they seem to be the only pizza place around us that has bone in chicken wings too. Bone in is always better than boneless lol I probably would give them a higher rating if they were more consistent with having a delivery option available.
author: Tiffany G.

description: I tried their gluten-free pizza, and it was amazzzzing! It tasted just like any other thin crust pizza (of course, with a tiny bit more chew, but still delicious). If you're looking for a gluten-free alternative but worry about whether it'll really be "as good," this is the place to go. Plus, they're quick (got a delivery) and toppings are yummy!
author: Ari R.

description: Escape from New York was my go-to until this place came around. Consistently excellent pizza. The kale salad is also off da hook. So glad to have this addition to the neighborhood.
author: John L.

description: Yay!! This place is awesome. Did the 1/2 norty, 1/2 widower and was not disappointed. So much meat on the widower and the norty combo of potato and asparagus and cheese is fantastic! Delivery on a Friday at 8 on my took 30 minutes!! So happy to have found this place. Will definitely be regulars :)
author: Kristin D.

description: Just not very good.  Been there multiple times and always waaay too greasy and just not that fresh tasting..wish I could give it a better review...
author: Wilson B.

description: Yeah rude service. Not friendly, ok pizza. Good for a quick bite that's it. Too bad because it's in a really good location. Right at the corner, near my yoga place!
author: Yodlee Y.

description: I can honestly say that this os the best pizza I was not pan tixzza plaves around your area. Out here in sf theres are soo many good questions.  Presidio pizza company will always have my money.  Best pizza in my opinion. To each the there ever.
author: Adam L.

description: Really good pizza, good music and friendly service.  We got the nortys and they made it right in front of us with a lot of fun. Everything is homemade and you can taste it.
author: Shannon H.

description:
Update: The manager wrote me a personal message here to further exasperate my negative experience in the same manner that caused me to write the review in the first place. Do yourselves a favor and just avoid this place. Food isn't super great and they clearly are pretty rude and disorganized.

--------

I'm writing this review because I had a pretty bad experience recently. During my most recent visit I waited 20 minutes for my couple slices to be reheated, when it shouldn't take more than 5 minutes. I found out it got burned while the guy who put it in the oven stood over someone else's shoulder to learn something and forgot about it.

This was the second visit in a row where this happened, so I mention it to the manager, because if this is the usual occurrence for many customers, I wouldn't be surprised if they stop coming back. I wasn't terribly upset, but I let him know it would have been nice if I was offered a drink or something else for my time. At that point I didn't care I just wanted to let them know I was slightly annoyed and move on.

What actually got me upset is while I was explaining to the manager my experience (who was actually the one who did this last time), the guy who took my order comes over and scoffs at me about how already explained what happened and fixed it. I then reiterated my point that I was only annoyed because this is the second time this has happened. The manager then acts confused as if that wasn't possible so I explain that he was actually at fault last time. He blatantly denies it was him and implies I'm mistaken. Case and point, that's because he for about my food and never checked in afterward, the owner fixed the problem. 

So I wasted a bunch of my time and was basically called delusional about the details of my visits to this establishment. I've worked in retail so I'm understanding to a busy environment, but this type of conversation should never happen, a simple "thanks for the feedback" would have been much better. It appears this is typical based on other reviews
author: Eric B.

description: On the way to the Alameda County Fair, stopped off at this place and ordered small pizza with salami. Prompt service, more than enough for two, but not the best pizza ever. Crust was extremely thin and when you picked it up, it tended to droop the topping and let it fall to the table as it transferred from the serving platter to the plate. The taste was good and there was one piece left over. I would go back but I still think there are better pizzas out there.
author: Nick L.

description: I always get the calamari and a calzone. Their calzones are one of the best I've ever had (and I use to work for a pizza joint before). They're stuffed so much but still cooked thoroughly...which is always awesome! And the calamari is great and filling. Their slices are always delicious and handy if you need a quick bite. The service is always friendly and fast for how busy they can be. I've recommended this spot to some friends and now it's the only place they go to get pizza. Check it out!
author: Nicole G.

description: Not a huge fan of the regular pizza, but I will say they have the best gluten free pizza in the city.  My boyfriend insisted on ordering a few slices of the regular pizza because he doesnt always want to listen to me and guess what?  He also liked the Gluten free pizza much better than the regular.  Its quite a bit more expensive than the regular pizza but totally worth it.   This place is super convenient for me because its literally across the street from my yoga studio "YogaWorks" so go to yoga and then grab a pizza on your way home.  The guys that work here are super nice too!
author: Coraly S.

description: Finally!!!  Great pizza in my neighborhood.  Thank god for this place.  Staff & service are excellent.  Pizza quality is SUPERB...
author: Smoking D.

description: 5 stars for the pizza and service! I've been there ~10 times and that says something. The pizza is tasty, Anthony and the crew there seem very cool, and when I bring 2 little ones in, they are super friendly to them like giving them dough to play with. Then, on my visit yesterday, I found out kids eat free on Mondays (slice & drink)! Awesome!
author: jey o.

description: Excellent addition to the neighborhood! The pizza was great: soft sweet crust, spicy sauce and plentiful fresh toppings. Cute simple decor with enough room for a stoller. Friendly waitress who brought out a little pizza toy for my nephew. And bomb buffalo wings! Second to Golden Boy, this is my favorite spot. Will certainly be back!
author: Bri J.

description:
I'll preface this review by describing my pizza background: Raised on pizza in Manhattan. Have lived and enjoyed pizza in Chicago, Boston, Miami and various Italian cities over the years. I love Manhattan pizza and the Chicago-style deep dish  pies from Uno's, Due's and Totorice's. When I moved to SF in 1977 the pizza scene was pretty grim. Everyone loved a place called The Front Room where the pizza had a cardboard crust and sauce that tasted like weak ketchup. Pretty awful. There was (and is) Giorgio's on Clement Street that did a fairly good job. And there was (and is) Pasquale's on Irving that also had a good crust and decent sauce. Then in 1979 two guys from Brooklyn opened the first Village Pizza on Steiner Street in The Marina. I was there on the second day and it was like dying and going back to New York pizza heaven. The crust, the sauce, the toppings were all the real thing. The whole thing was heavenly. Village has had its ups and downs over the years but their two outlets (Clement @ Arguello, Van Ness @ Sutter) are still pretty true to the original. And I still have my pies delivered from the Clement Street store. To be honest, Mozzarella Di Bufala restaurant in West Portal also does a great pie but they don't deliver and it's a long drive for me.

All that said, I was pretty excited when a new pizzeria landed in my neighborhood at Divisadero and California. We hadn't had a pizza joint that I could walk to since Bus Stop closed their local shop a few years ago. Although I had walked by it many times it wasn't until yesterday (5/13/2014) that I decided to go in and get a couple of slices for lunch. Their menu is short and sweet and easy to maneuver. They have a few starters and salads along with a couple of sandwiches for those who don't want pizza. Pizza comes in round and square shapes along with a calzone. Never having tasted their pizza I chose one of their "House Favorite Combination Pies" called the "Widow Maker" with salami, house sausage, pepperoni, meatball and "grande" mozzarella on a thin crust. Each slice was $4.50 plus tax. The slices came from a pre-cooked pie that was on display in a case on the counter along with a number of other types. With a quick warm-up in the pizza oven the slices were ready to eat in no time.

I'll keep this short and sweet by saying that I'm glad Village Pizza is still around because, no matter how close this place is to me (an easy walk), I won't be going back. Perhaps my fist clue should have been the lack of any aroma wafting out the door. As long as I've passed by here I have never been lured in by the smell of pizza cooking. Perhaps this is due to the complete lack of flavor in the pizza. The sauce was almost tasteless. The mozzarella topping was very generous but tasteless. The crust was limp with a bit of yeast in the flavor but bland. As for the toppings; the two slices shared 1 1/2 slices of salami, seven small pieces of crumbled sausage and two small pieces of meatball. If there was any pepperoni on board I didn't see it. The whole picture was tomato sauce covered with melted mozzarella and a few pieces of "stuff". If this is what they consider one of their "House Favorite Combination Pies" I'm wondering who voted for it because what they define as a "favorite" is far from what I consider a "favorite".

They've had a few months to work out the kinks so this poor performance wasn't just a function of being new and a start-up. I realize that a lot of people will patronize the place simply for the location. They have a built-in lunch market from the Drew School boneheads and the massive hordes of medical workers in the neighborhood. So they'll make it on lunch alone. But if you're looking for good pizza and have a choice, this is not the place for you. You'll walk out still hungry for the pizza you didn't get.
author: H O.

description:
I've been here a bunch of times and it's pretty inconsistent. Sometimes you get a great slice of pizza and other times you get cardboard with some cheese on it. It all depends on how long the slice has been sitting on the shelf (which I think more often than not is a long time). Unfortunately I think that either means 1) not too many people are going in and ordering slices or 2) they cook too many pies ahead of time and they sit there for a while.

The people are nice and I like the concept of the place (good menu) . I wish they consistently had fresh slices available though and then this place would be a solid 4 stars. 

I will say, it is the best option out of the horrible slice options on Divisadero. And I hear we are getting more crappy take out pizza places soon!
author: Tom S.

description:
Mmmm... OK

I've been here on a few occasions as it is the closest pizza place now to where I live.

The good: open late (more late night options needed in this area!), liked the Grandma/pesto pizza, decent garlic breadsticks.

The bad: slow service, both with dining in and getting to-go. Seriously how long does it take to reheat a slice of pizza? Pepperoni was greasy and bland. Expensive for whole pizzas, would only order a slice or two.
