Giving an extra star for the convenience factor, but wish the food quality and service were better.
author: Caroline S.

description:
We live right around the corner so when it opened we had high hopes as there aren't a ton of reliable pizza places in Pac Heights.  We first went to PPC on one of their very first nights... No signage, no tv on the wall yet, etc. People seemed to still be getting the hang of things but that is perfectly acceptable for a new place, esp if the food is great.  That night we ordered the meat balls and salad to share, then I ordered two slices of pizza as I had to know how their pizza would stack up.  Meat balls were tasty and filling and the red sauce was great, plus the salad was decent although was lacking something I'm not sure what.  The pizza was good, not spectacular, with good sauce, dough, cheese, and adequate toppings.  I wouldn't say it blew away some of the other pizza options in the area, but it was very good and still beat them out overall in my opinion.  They claim to be NY style, and as an East Coaster I would say they are pretty close.

We have now been back several times and they always seem to be making additions to the decor (tv, some other decorations) which is nice and makes me feel they will be around a while.  The seating is a little difficult but not surprising given the small space... We have sat at the two person table immediately in front of the door and it tends to get crowded, but again you have to expect that.  Extra points for always having slices ready to go, as that is hard to find in the area, and I am usually looking for pizza fast and hot to go.  There are a few beer and wine choices, but that's ok to me... You probably aren't getting too creative with what you drink with pizza anyway.  

Happy this place replaced the European bar or whatever was there before, I just hope it sticks around for a while as it's now worked its way into my go-to stable for quick pizza slices and casual eats with the wife.
author: Brad W.

description: I consider myself picky when it comes to food, especially pizza. For a small joint, everything was really good . Fried calamari- good portion and really good! A little spicy - perfect. Chopped salad was excellent. Pizza was really good! If you have a little one, they will give him/her a little doe to play with. Will definitely come back.
author: Igor O.

description: I stopped in for a slice of pizza, which was decent. However, as I was eating I saw a mouse crawling a few feet away. I informed the staff, including someone who seemed to be the owner or manager. One of the staff eventually tried to cover up the hole where the mouse came from, but it wasn't exactly appetizing to eat while watching a mouse scurry around. I was a little surprised that no one on staff either apologized or acknowledged that dining with a mouse isn't the norm. Instead, people seemed a bit nonchalant about it.
author: Luna S.

description: Granted we miss Frankie's, but we had had high and optimistic hopes for PP. Been there more than once. On the second occasion, we ordered a whole pizza.  While waiting, a second group was given our pizza without any thought. We continued to wait patiently but we're not given any compensation. Based on service and taste I will not be back even though I LIVE ACROSS the street. Dino's is better.
author: Lauren K.

description:
Finally, after living in San Francisco for 23 years, I am happy to report that there is a great slice of NY pizza in town. It's the real deal -- the owner Frankie is from Brooklyn and knows his pizza . He uses all the correct brands of NY ingredients and uses them perfectly. And the pie is a reasonable price -- $3/slice, $18 for a whole large pie -- it looked to me like 18" in diameter at least. I talked to Frankie, Norty (perfect East Coast name), and Josh, who make the pies, and they are very friendly, down-to-earth, easy-to-talk to guys. 

They have other styles of pizza -- I tried the Grandma style (a Long-Island favorite that is a square slice with sauce, fresh mozarella and basil), and it was great. Didn't get to try the Sicilian slice.

If like me, you are tired of all of the all-hat, no-cattle pizzerias in SF that talk about what stonemason from the hills of Puglia made the bricks for their oven but produce lousy pizza, then this is your antidote. Presidio Pizza makes great pizza and if you make great pizza, no one needs to know or cares what oven you used.

If you are tired of Neapolitan pizzas that are fired at 900 degrees and come out gummy on the inside because the people making them don't have the skills to do it right (which is pretty much most of the Neapolitan pizza in SF), then Presidio Pizza is your antidote. 

If you are tired of spending $20 on a 12" pizza that has no taste, then Presidio Pizza is your antidote, You can get an amazing pizza that is 2 1/4 times the size for $2 less! (For those interested in pizza math, since the area of a circle is pi * r**2, a 12" pie is 113 square inches, while an 18" pie is 254 sq. in).

Besides pizza, they also have meatball and chicken parm heros, salads, calzone, a great roasted-vegetable antipasto, and many other dishes. Dessert includes a Nutella pizza and cannoli.

The environment for eating in is very nice and relazing.

Kudos to Frankie and gang for creating a pizza place that provides a slice of NY pizza in a friendly, unpretentious way.
author: Norm M.

description: I asked Presidio Pizza to accommodate a birthday party of 10 to 12 late on a Monday night and they came through in spades. Great service, great attitude, great food and wine. The arrangements could not have been easier and everyone was happy and helpful. It was a perfect finish to our evening. Love their pizza. I stop in for lunch whenever I can.
author: Kimball W.

description: After 30+ years of searching, taste testing, sacrifice, I finally found a pizza place in San Francisco that makes the crust exactly as I like it--cooked!  Seems like a small thing to require but, obviously, not as easy as one would think considering all the pizzas I've had to suffer through with these wimpy crusts.  I've never been into deep dish or thick crust, I like the crust thin enough so you can fold the pizza yet not to under cooked I have to stick it in my home oven just to cook it for another 10 mins.  I was just minding my own business one day after having blood drawn at the U.C. Med. facility, I had literally hours to kill before my flu shot appointment.  Since I had to fast for 12 hours before the blood test, I hadn't eaten for a very long time, and since there is NOTHING to do in that area (you'd think someone would put up gift shops or something even slightly distracting but all I could find was a couple medical supplies/equipment shops and a small pharmacy and there's only so much interest I have for portable commodes), and since I was hungry and thirsty, and since this pizza shop was almost empty, I ducked inside here.  I don't generally like to eat alone at eateries but the planets were aligned just right and I was hungry.  Got a slice, I think it was called Frankie but maybe not--it was one of those point to it situations, and a glass of icy lemon infused water and it was delicious, just exactly the right spices in the sauce, oh, man, and the crust was perfection.  Every single other pizza place in this town needs to go learn how to make this crust.  Watched a little tv, thought the staff was friendly and nice.  So now I want to try all the rest but  how am I going to get them to deliver this far away (just west and right under U.C. Med. Parnassus)????
author: Kai T.

description: Wonderful pizza! New York style -- thin & chewy crust, large slices -- my favorite. And, the staff were extremely nice and seemed to love their workplace & product. Casual stop-in for a whole pie but great for take out and by the slice, too.
author: Audrey A.

description: Presidio Pizza has quickly become a staple of the neighborhood, and definitely a spot I love bringing friends and family too! Frank and the crew there do a stellar job, consistently producing properly cooked, NY style pies with decadent sauce and just the right amount of cheese. Delivery is convenient, but the vibe in the restaurant seems to keep getting better, so we've been eating out a little more often. They made my birthday dinner a great time, and I hope they are here to stay for a very long time.
author: Mark C.

description: This place is really yummy, and has a great atmosphere whether you're here for a pie or just a slice. This review is mostly for Katya though - super cute, cool, and helpful cashier who was very accommodating and friendly while my friend and I were waiting to snag a seat. Definitely will be back, thanks to her great service and the tasty pies.
author: Julia N.

description: Solid pizza, I'm a New Yorker and this is probably the best pie in the city outside of Arinell.
author: Chase N.

description: Love this place!  Took my two very active boys there tonight and they couldn't have been nicer!  The garlic knots were amazing as well as the pizza!  YUM! The guys working there are super friendly and great.  They have incredible happy hour deals which we will be trying! Then pizza was delicious!
author: Jill W.

description: Love it! My husband is a New Yorker and is so particular about his pizza, we both can agree on this place. Quick, friendly and delicious. Their standards (cheese & pepperoni) are great, and I've just branched into specialties- current fave is the Norty's. Also had a kale Caesar special last time we were in- a winner. Plus they just started to deliver- now they are perfect.
author: Debbie T.

description: Their pizzas are HUUUUUGEEE! They're open very late on the weekends, so you can grab a slice of greasy after polishing off your drinks at Fishbowl (or elsewhere) And any other day they're open until 11pm which is also pretty late by this neighborhood's standards. Pizza and wine on tap will keep me coming back here!
author: Tatyana K.

description: Pretty convenient pizza place. I work down the street so the fact that they sell pizza by the slice is great. I've only tried the bianca and the chicken one. Both are pretty tasty. Today I tried the chicken sandwich. It was good except they forgot my fresh mozzarella! Which is practically the best part. Plus $10 for a sandwich? Meh, not worth it. The pizza slices are much more affordable and you get a good bang for your buck. All in all, cool place. I'll be frequenting here often.
author: Elise E.

description: The calamari with Serrano peppers was awesome also had the Sicilian with pepperoni and it was delicious, so excited that we finally have an awesome pizza joint in the city, I will be coming back for sure
author: Jordan K.

description: We had the round pepperoni pizza and calzone delivered with a cannoli. The pizza was massive as far as pizza in SF goes, but the sauce was a bit underwhelming. The calzone was solid, and the cannoli was as well, but both seemed unfortunately forgettable.
author: Matt R.

description: Ordered for delivery on a Friday night - trying it out as we're looking for a good pizza spot to call home.  Asked for it to be delivered at 7:39.  It was a half hour too early so cold by the time we ate and was the wrong pizza.  Pizza was fine but not great.
author: Jen P.

description: Pizza was okay. Service great - bantered with cash register guy and he offered me a free slice next time I come by.
author: Paulina P.

description: I love pizza and this is as good as it gets.  We celebrated my daughter's Thirteenth Birthday there with a large group of family and friends.  The owner and company made it very special.  I cannot talk enough about the pizza and the food.  From the dough to the cheese, the sauce and the toppings you can taste the quality of the ingredients, balanced to perfection.  We all left the place very happy and I noticed the rest of the customers felt the same way.  Frankie, the owner from Brooklyn, is a  graceful and charming man who is in charge of his restaurant.  Fantastic experience!
author: Garen E.

description: My favorite pizza place in town. The staff is very friendly and considerate. And Who doesn't like a huge pizza with a combination of your two favorite flavors?! Highly recommend the pesto chicken! Can be pretty loud sometimes or quite a wait when it's crowded but.. It is totally worth it.
author: Patricia D.

description: The Roast beef Sando is killin' it. The Anjou and gardeneria veggies are strong so the malbec is the best pairing choice
author: Anthony R.

description: The owner Frankie is a true Italian artist. His pizza works of art taste absolutely authentic.
author: Paul L.

description: Good prices, great flavor.  One of the best i have had for a while.  Fresh, counter help is very pleasant.  Customers that were in there, loved the food.  I have become a loyal customer and so far have tried almost everything.  Today was my first Sandwich from them, awesome.  If you get the opportunity to try one, they are worth it.
author: Del B.

description: Not the best pizza we've had - had the Frankie and divy pie (?) split.  Portions are good - large slices.  It was a little wet for us = soggy crust plus with indistinct flavors.  If you like saucy pizza, you may enjoy the pizza here.  Romaine lettuce salad and wings were not bad, but not that memorable.  We prefer Blue Line or Palo Alto Pizza Co.  Service was fantastic though.
author: Neelie O.

description: This place is legit. Found out sous chef is from Boston and owner from Brooklyn. The service here is sweet and, the variety in drinks and items to order is wonderful. After reading Juicy P's review, I asked them to make my slice "extra crispy" and, it totally delivered. I ordered the "Norty's" with a bottle of Lagunitas "Little Sumpin'". So glad this place is now in the hood. Hopefully, they'll start delivering soon so I won't have to walk the two blocks ;)
author: Jen H.

description: Great food. Wonderful, friendly people who work here. Close to UCSF Mt Zion Hospital. Price is right, too.
author: Martin F.

description: Very good and I've been yearning for a good pizza place in PAC Heights. We ordered a thin pepperoni, mushroom and sausage pizza and the garlic herb knots. Both were delicious and better than Dino's. The mushrooms were fresh, the sausage fresh and tastey and the cheese fresh. I like their pizza sauce. I loved the garlic herb knots, as I've been waiting for a place to have these. The link to their menu via mobile is http://www.scribd.com/mobile/doc/192790917
author: Vanessa B.

description:
I am SO happy with the Presidio Pizza Company!  We have gotten pizza delivered twice by PPC, and they have surpassed our expectations for timely delivery in the city AND the pizza tastes great.  I'm from Chicago, so saying the pizza tastes great means something, haha:-)
Anyway, the PPC pizza crust has a sourdough flavor, and I loved it.  They are very generous with the amount of toppings they put on your pizza.  I look forward to dining in the restaurant (and ordering delivery again soon) as I've heard this place is also amazing at accommodating families with young children and their parents with daily "happy hour" kids pizza specials and adult drink specials.  
Keep up the good work, PPC!
author: Kim S.

description:
As I am originally from NY, I'm always on the lookout for great pizza places. Today I stumbled upon such a place. Staff was very friendly and the service was fantastic. Server thought she had lost some of her Long Island accent,but to me it was plain as day. Nice little shop with warm atmosphere. Not a lot of frills, but I'm not there for that. Reminds me of the places my father would take me to as a kid, every Saturday night. 
My only con is there was no tshirts. The staff assured me they were working on them though. Now when I am asked to go to SF my mouth starts watering a bit. Norty I'll be back at the latest in 3 months. Looking forward to the great pizza and a hopefully some shirts.
author: Chris C.

description: Got one of the Sicilian slices and one of the regular round slices. The thin crust was very nice, held its shape but had a nice crunch to each bite. Sicilian was a little heavier on the delicious tomato sauce. I'm a fan. Good addition to the area. The management doesn't seem to have the staff operating efficiently yet, but this wasn't an issue for me since I went in mid-afternoon on a Tuesday when there were only a small handful of other customers present.
author: Robbie K.

description: We happened in here by accident since we had an appointment at the nearby hospital.  What a treat!  The two of us shared their wonderful Pizza Pocket (we added pepperoni).  It was amazing!  Everything here is fresh.  We could even see the giant mixer going in the back making a new batch of fresh dough.  Nice, nice staff.  It does take a little longer to get the Pizza Pocket but if you aren't in a hurry,  it is worth the wait.  DELICIOUS!!
author: Debbie H.

description: Oh Yeah! Had 2 plain cheese slices. For me it's "as close to NY pizza without being in NY" as you can get out west!
author: Walter W.

description: Delicious!  As a former New Yorker, I can be pretty snobby about pizza and mostly avoid it in SF.  I'm really excited to have a good pizza joint nearby now!  We ordered the grandma's pizza and it was really good.  Great crust, really fast dough.  Got the garlic knots and they were very garlicky but very tasty. The staff are also really nice.  We ordered it for take out and it was ready when they said, and they even brought it out to my husband because he had our dog with him.  I'd definitely add this place to our list and visit again.
author: Jill G.

description: This place rocks for being open so late. I was driving home from a concert late at night and stopped to get a slice of pizza. It was so, so good! Their red pizza sauce is delicious! Thank you for being open so late and for serving great pizza!
author: Tori S.

description: Super friendly staff and the thin crust pizza is pretty much NYC style. Great cause, thats all I gotta say. Its my go to pizza spot now. Check it out.
author: Elisa P.

description: This place was great, the service was fine and the owners are down to earth. I recommend this place for the late night munchers. The pesto is up to par!
author: Rama K.

description:
Delicious food, great service, cute environment, good prices, and open late!

Way better than extreme-ly overpriced pizza a few blocks away.
author: Lele L.

description: Really a 3.5 star, but I'll round up for  friendly service. Pizza specials are pretty good, I wonder where they got the pepperoni, it's delicious. Unfortunately they didn't have all of their specials when I went, the first 2 I asked for were actually in available :/ but the Sicilian style and "Widow Maker" were delish, the "Divis and Pie" was just ok.
author: Nik K.

description: Wasn't impressed the first time (except they have Sumpin' beer! Yea!) we ate there, but went back due to its close proximity and a voracious craving for pizza! We ordered, pepperoni, black olive, and ALRUGELA (love that stuff, and it's not so easily found as a regular topping!)! It was most wonderful, and the crust surprisingly right up my alley (I'm very picky when it comes to crusts!)! My friend concurred, and we found that with our uneaten portion (we stuffed ourselves!) warmed up perfectly in the OVEN the following day. The crust hadn't hardened, and all ingredients still fresh (including the alrugala - sorry if I'm misspelling that!)! The service is excellent, as employees seem happy to help you and are prompt. My only complaint is, that if you want a whole pie, you are made to order a large one, because there are no other sizes, but the slices (of course they use a smaller pan for them, but somehow they cannot pull off a medium sized one, for those who don't want a large pizza!)! It all turned out well because we enjoyed the pizza so much, we were glad to consume it the next day, and with a much enthusiasm! I do very much recommend them for delightful beer, and good eats! Oh, and also the decor is quite pleasant because they open up they extra doors to let in the sun and a slight refreshing breeze (pizza kitchens /stoves can make parlors quite stuffy!) in, which is one of the reasons I love S.F.!
author: Cecelia C.

description:
Ok, I am updating my review! I have returned two more times and things have gotten better in terms of service. They can be a little disorganized when it is slightly busy. They don't seem to have a "system", but I must say they seem more attentive and they are trying. Again the pizza is tasty and it is only 3 blocks from my apt. So I will continue to return! Also I have changed my score to 4 stars.

The pizza was solid! I did enjoy my slice and the homemade hot sauce. The reason I gave this place 3 stars is because the service was poor. I was standing at the counter waiting for someone to help me order a slice. It took almost 5 minutes for someone to acknowledge me:(. I asked the girl questions about the pizza and about the gluten free option - she was clueless and said " I don't know" to all my questions. She didn't seem to know much about the product she was selling. She didn't even make an attempt to try to answer my questions. She appeared to care less about her job. I was the only one in the place besides a table of two. I live about 3 blocks away from this place so I will go back and see if the service improves... I will change my score if it does.
author: Sara S.

description:
I love this place. Not only can you find some really quality pizza for a good price (a difficult thing in this city), but the people who work here are really great. Hell, they'll even deliver your pizza to the park (Alta Plaza) if you're nice.

(Yes, you can have pizzas delivered to the park while you drink your beverage, and, yes, this will make everyone around you at the park go, "Whaaaa?!? No way bro!")
author: M G.

description:
THIS IS MY FIRST YELP REVIEW EVER... :) 

Because this place rocks -- the service, the kale salad, the divis & pie and frankie's pizza; the whole situation! So refreshing to just walk right in...friendly people...I am a HUGE fan! I want it to be my little secret but promised them I'd scream it from the mountaintops...you won't be disappointed.
author: Meg S.

description:
This is the best pizzeria in sf.
I never had good New York style pizza till I've came here.
Frank Bumbalo did a very good job on choosing his staff,they are all amazing ,very kind and friendly.
It's very welcoming and I'm comfortable eating there :)
author: Nisha I.

description: Simply put, I love this place. The food is fantastic. The ambiance is excellent.  And the service is top notch. Also, I suggest that you make it a point to treat yourself to a East Coast pizzeria staple, the grandma slice.
author: Michael H.

description: Pizza is ok. Everything else about my 3 different experiences has been far from ok. The first time I ordered take-out and they got the wrong pizza. They kept apologizing and seemed very nice, so I gave them another chance. The second time it took over 2 hours for them to deliver my pizza even though I only live 3 blocks from away! They originally told me it would take 1 hour or less. Delivery man kept apologizing so I gave them a third try.  The 3rd and final time I called Presidio the poor girl answering the phone could just not stay focused or organized to save her life. She had me hold over 4 times, and then she put the wrong address for the delivery guy. He showed up over 2 hours later (different man than the 2nd time) and kept apologizing saying the girl had written the wrong address. He could tell I was upset and asked me to give them another chance. This place is obviously extremely poorly managed. Get it together. Won't ever eat there again.
author: Aaron L.

description: I've only ordered a pie to go so far, so I can't speak to the service or the side dishes, but I'm a fan of the pizza. For some reason, it's *really* hard to find good NY-style pizza in San Francisco, but these guys manage to do it right. Big, foldable slices with a thin, chewy crust and good quality toppings. It also passed the "is it good cold the next day?" test. I'll be back.
author: D V.

description: not great or not bad but people who handle food should NOT be handling your food and money - not very sanitary
author: Michael W.

description: Some of the best pizza in the city.  I'm from Brooklyn and this place is legit!
author: David P.

description:
One bite of the Sicilian slice and I was transported to my childhood neighborhood in Bensonhurst, Brooklyn. I was Frankie again!  

There are many excellent pizzas in San Francisco but Presidio Pizza is the truest Brooklyn style pizza. 

Thanks again one Frankie to another!
author: Frank P.

description: The curly haired lady ringing people up is not too bright. People were lining up in front of the pizza but she was helping people as they came up to her at the cash register. Any smart person would acknowledge the people that were there first! Instead she helped all the people that came in last and they took almost all if the pizza that was left! Maybe I'm just annoyed because I'm one of the only people who is sober, or maybe it's because I've worked in restaurants for a long time and can clearly identify poor service! Either way, the pizza here is awesome but if they'd just hire smart people to give good service, it'd be sooo much better!!!! Good luck!
author: Elle J.

description: This place is a gem. They have pizza down! My husband and I eat here once a week - the calzone is amazing. Love the cool, casual vibe. Always had great service dining in and timely take out service.
author: Hourik G.

description: I ordered a pizza over an hour and a half ago and it still hasn't been delivered to my hotel. I was quoted 45 minutes, I figured I would be patient and wait an hour. It did finally show up after an hour and a half. While the pizza is admittedly good, the wait time was out-of-control.
author: Stephen M.

description: Sooo, I'm from New York, strong island to be exact. Now I am proud to be a Californian never going back to frigid cold winters BUT I do miss some things.. Swimming in the ocean without a wet suit and obviously pizza and bagels. Haven't found a bagel place quite perfect yet, but Franky, thank you for making pizza that tastes like home!
author: Rachel W.

description: Great pizza!  Slices are pretty cheap and so many options!  The rest of the menu is delicious too.  Staff is friendly.  Highly recommend it.
author: Jess J.

description: East coaster in search of good pizza in sf. This place is it without having to pay a crazy amount it wait two hours. Dude who manages on a Sat night is super nice, giving my baby some pizza dough to play with.  Bianca is amaze balls. Other topping combos were fantastic too. Definitely my new go to for pizza. Thank you, sf needed this place.
author: shar d.

description: Hate to write this review - 1/because we are in the neighborhood; 2/because we've gone to this place several times; 3/because we're afraid what will go in if this place goes away.  BUT just ordered takeout - super simple order - 1 pizza that is half cheese and half sausage/olive + caesar with chicken. They said it would be ready in 30 mins. My husband goes to pick it up, and an hour later, its finally ready. They made some excuse that "a bunch of people" came in.. what?  They also asked if "we wanted the pizza to be baked already".  It sounds as though they weren't prepared for the holiday weekend, and weren't organized, since typically, takeout doesn't create any backup because you don't have to service people at a table.  Plus they weren't even busy... next time, please just be honest and say "we forgot, we blew it, we missed your order" - and then actually give some sort of concession (free beer, discount off the order, coupon for the next visit).  Total bummer!!!
author: SY K.

description: Perhaps one of the worst restaurant experiences in San Francisco.  We went here for my bothers birthday dinner casual night with kids.   Not only was the pizza sub par, but the service was simply horrid.  We ordered drinks and they came 20 min later (beers flat and room temp).  Then our order of salads never came, we had to ask our server said they were sent out on a take out order by accident.  One hour later (with hungry kids) we asked where the four pizzas we ordered were.   Seeing a panicked look on our servers face she came back and said the order was never put in.  Just nuts!  We then bought every slice in the window under the warmer. Ate in 10 min and left.  With all the great pizza and service in town this place in an AVOID!
author: J K.

description: I drive by frequently and I love the new look and wanted to stop by to check it out.  It is awkward when you enter.  There were a lot of customers milling about.  We ordered at the register and sat down, then we learned that we were supposed to order from a waitress.  They could do a better job greeting customers and explaining this.  Then they wanted to add an extra fee to use my credit card.  It's rare that I get this request today with all the merchant friendly credit card options like Square.  I felt like I was traveling back in time.  I won't be back until the credit card fee is removed.
author: charlie c.

description: okay pizza. not great, not terrible. $5/slice w/ drink or $8/2slices w/ drink. the triangular cut slices are a decent size but definitely smaller than your typical standard NY slice. the square cut slices are even smaller and because of that, are a disappointment. the woman at the cash register was enthusiastic, which was nice and almost convincing. if she keeps up with that and they make bigger square cuts they might have a fighting chance. there are a lot of hospital workers in the area who would definitely stop in for a slice if this place pans out.
author: Regina C.

description: Good pizza and have now tried their pizza on numerous occasions and does not disappoint.  The owner (Frank?) is super nice and the rest of the employees have been nothing but nice in my frequent visits (eat in and take out). I expect this to continue to gain in popularity as the word gets out.  BTW, Ocean Tacqueria next door is a sleeper and makes great Mexican food.  One two combo on this block only thing missing in a world class coffee shop for the trifecta!
author: mike s.

description: I had just moved to SF, and was without cooking supplies or groceries, coming home from a late night at my new job. I desperately searched yelp to find somewhere open. Presidio Pizza was, so I called and placed a custom order. They were so friendly and the pizza and salad were delicious. I had enough food for the rest of the week! I'm only giving 4 stars instead of 5 because there's a waiter there that always gets our order wrong... But besides that they're fantastic!
author: Cassie S.

description: Pizza is decent but to go service blows. Been here twice for take out. The first time I asked for a slice of pizza and the chick told me it had already been "sold" to someone else. The second time I waited 20 minutes for them to heat up 2 slices. Over it and their overpriced pizza.
author: Susan M.

description: I've been here a few times now, and the pizza is great but the service is not. They've made me wait much longer than I should have on numerous occasions. I'm torn about whether to continue coming back here.
author: A P.

description: Pizza is solid (not amazing), but the service is terrible. On 1 occasion my pizza took an hour before it was ready (after my server said it would take 25). It also took about 10 minutes to even get his attention because he was on the phone taking pick up orders before he even attended people at the restaurant. On another occasion I waited for about ten minutes and then left because no one had taken in my order (no one else in line).
author: Rohan S.

description: They keep getting better! Eating the Garlic Knots fresh out of the oven make me feel like I'm in Grandma's kitchen, warm and happy. A new pizza by the slice discount program rewards those of us who need a slice frequently. All the front of the house staff are learning and refining their customer service - much like an excellent neighbor place would do. I'm amused by some of the writeups here because I for one am not so important that waiting a few minutes turns me into a miserable sap - I love this place and it just keeps getting better.
author: Paul D.

description: I ordered a large pizza to go and the staff was very attentive and friendly.  Unfortunately the pizza did not impress.  I could describe it as chewing on a tired shoe sole or a thick piece of cardboard.  I will not be going back here
author: Simon B.

description: if you're looking for authentic NY style pizza in California, you should check out Presidio Pizza Company.  Born and raised in Brooklyn, NY, I've yet to find a pizzeria that serves anything near NY style pizza on the west coast until now.  I took one bite of their plain cheese with pepperoni and was transported back to my favorite West Village pizzeria.  I can't wait to go back.  The service was also top notch!
author: Daniela D.

description: Got their slices late night on New Years, please stay open late all the time! Pizza is so good! Can't even describe how good their pepperoni is!!!
author: Michael V.

description: Good customer service, but they are soooo slow. It shouldn't take 30 minutes (plus!) for two slices of premade pizza, a Caesar salad, and a piece of cheesecake. I told her that it was for my grandma in the nursing facility across the street...the pizza crust was too hard for my grandma to chew. I tried it, and it was soooo disappointing. I will never come back here again.
author: N V.

description: I got the Half Frankie's Half Bianca and can I say food coma. Flavor right on. I am not from NYC but the crust was think like NY and the flavor of a Cali pie and can we say for what we got the price not bad. Now I did have it delivered did not go in not sure what the location is like but the time it took me to get the pie was 35-40 min about the same as any other place I order from but these guys take the cake on flavor.
author: Tim B.

description: As for SF pizza standards, very good slices at a decent price.   PPC is clearly working out the service kinks, but very friendly service.    Five star pizza, three star service, but I bet that  improves as they are get the operations nailed down.
author: D S.

description: Ordered a large cheese pizza. Meh. Just ok. Underwhelmed. Not enough sauce. Dry. Lacking flavor. Lived in NYC for 8 years. This sadly doesn't measure up.
author: Brian A.

description: Really, I LOVE your pizza. The sauce is the best, the crust is perfect, the toppings well-balanced and just-right. Your draft beer is fresh and crisp with beautiful, clean glasses. Everyone is friendly, and I'm so happy to see you here in the neighborhood. But your acoustics are Awful!!! Unfortunately can't return for a dine-in until you figure out a way to balance the noise that bounces off the walls. Patron conversation is amplified to migraine levels, and when you add the music and jarring kitchen sounds it's just too much. Fix this, and they will line up at the door to get in!
author: Samantha S.

description: Very excited about this spot. We've been a couple of times now. The atmosphere is great, sort of like a low key Delfina. The pies are very interesting and tasty. I'm partial to the Nordy's. Its great to have slices served all day and night, including after 2am on Friday and Saturday. They also have some unique beers by the bottle. Great to have a pizza place that doesn't just serve the usual domestic beer. I highly recommend.
author: Tyler S.

description: Visiting from LA and took the kids for pizza.... What a great find.  Reasonably priced, great service and able to please all 6 of us with our special requests no problem.  The best part was the Pizza and the parmigiana sandwhich were awesome!!! The gluten free crust was perfect too!!!  Would like to take a shop home with me:)
author: Beth D.

description: Great neighborhood pizza place.  Awesome selection of pizza toppings and a great little place to sit down and have a bite.  Very cozy and you can see your pizza being made form most seats.  Bear in mind this place has not been open that long and there are some kinks to iron out.  If you're expecting French Laundry, I don't know why you're eating here....They are very accommodating and will work to make things right by you if you are unsatisfied.  BOTTOM LINE, this is a great addition to the neighborhood and is a force to be reckoned with in the pizza game, especially the Norty!
author: Zach M.

description: pizza is damn good. they give you a box if you get slices which is great. not loaded with toppings but thats okay because the cheese is delicious. get the widowmaker. service isn't fast but the pizza is cooked well and it's worth it. got three slices for 12 bucks, swag.
author: Taylor M.

description: VERY good pizza and fast service on a weekend! Fresh ingredients, delicious thin crust, and hefty portions... plus, the beer selection is good. I will definitely come back for more!
author: Elise C.

description: Grandmas pizza was to die for, have to try it, just like ny pizza
author: Angela D.

description: I love the location.  I love the staff and I love the food.  I know it's still new and will only improve.  I've been there twice and popped over to the fishbowl for a nightcap.  I'll be back!
author: Craig S.

description: Outstanding NY Style Pizza...Best in SF that i've found so far, would highly recommend!
author: Jordan G.
